title: Blackbird Interactive
summary: Blackbird Interactive is a Canadian video game development studio based in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada. The company is currently responsible for developing Minecraft Legends alongside Mojang Studios, and was also previously responsible in assisting Mojang with development of Minecraft Earth.

title: Freeze top layer
summary: A freeze top layer is a feature found throughout the Overworld.

title: Super Duper Graphics Pack
summary: The Super Duper Graphics Pack is a canceled graphics upgrade that was formerly in development for Bedrock Edition.

title: Commands/fillbiome
summary: Fills a specified area of a region with a specific biome.

title: Block of Bamboo
summary:
The block of bamboo is a block made of bamboo.
A block of stripped bamboo is an alternate variant made by using an axe on a block of bamboo.

title: Ring Block
summary: The ring block is a type of block found in the Glide mini game in the Legacy Console Edition, which makes up the rings that players fly through in score attack mode. It comes in green, yellow and blue variants.

title: Nir Vaknin
summary: Nir "Ulraf" Vaknin is a Mojang Studios employee currently working as a gameplay developer at the headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden.

title: Mod ore
summary: mod_ore is a block of unknown use. It uses the same textures of the block of gold.

title: Bamboo Mosaic
summary: A bamboo mosaic is a decorative block crafted out of bamboo slabs.

title: Camel
summary: The camel is a passive mob found in desert villages that can be ridden by two players in the same time using a saddle.

title: Chiseled Bookshelf
summary: Chiseled bookshelves are blocks that can hold books, books and quills, written books, and enchanted books.

title: Bossbar
summary: A boss bar is a bar that can track a boss mob's health.

title: Fire patch
summary: A fire patch is a feature that consists of fire or soul fire.

title: Glow lichen (feature)
summary: A glow lichen is a feature that consist of several glow lichen blocks.

title: Underwater magma
summary: An underwater magma is a feature found underwater in the Overworld.

title: Bamboo (feature)
summary: A bamboo is a feature that consist of bamboo blocks, found throughout old growth taiga biomes.

title: Vines (feature)
summary: Vines are features that consist of a single vines block.

title: Old Buffet world generators
summary: The Buffet world type used to have two extra generator types which were removed in Java Edition 1.18 due to bugs and lack of support.

title: Feature
summary: Features (aka. generated features) are small decorators generated in each chunk after terrain generation. This page lists generated features in a Minecraft world.

title: Custom carver
summary: Carvers are used to add caves and canyons.

title: Density function
summary: Density functions make up mathematical expressions to obtain a number from a position, stored as JSON files within a data pack in the path data/<namespace>/worldgen/noise_settings.

title: World preset
summary: World preset is used to determine what dimensions a new world has, which can be customized by data pack. When creating a new world, in the "More World Options..." screen, you can choose which world preset to use, or not use a world preset.

title: Custom world preset
summary: World presets can be chosen in "World Type" button in "More World Options..." screen in "Create New World" to determine what dimensions the new world has.

title: Pile
summary: A pile is a feature that generates only inside villages.

title: List of common misconceptions
summary: This page intends to collect and debunk several commonly-circulated falsehoods regarding game mechanics, blocks, items, and other elements of the Minecraft franchise.

title: Gamemode 9
summary: Game mode 9 is one of the secret game modes in Minecraft: Bedrock Edition.

title: Tooltip
summary: A tooltip is a piece of text that appears when hovering over or focusing on certain elements in the user interfaces, or when switching the held item.

title: Teacher Menu
summary: The Teacher Menu was a feature in MinecraftEdu. It was used by teachers to make learning easier.

title: Commands/codebuilder
summary: Starts a codebuilder.

title: Commands/lesson
summary: /lesson starts a lesson.

title: Number Block
summary: Number blocks were mathematical blocks in MinecraftEdu.

title: Narrator
summary: Pressing Ctrl + B toggles the narrator, a text-to-speech engine that automatically reads chat messages, including the username.

title: Commands/volumearea
summary: Add, remove, or list volumes in the current dimension.

title: Hell (map theme)
summary: Hell was one of the map themes used during Minecraft's Indev stage, and was eventually removed in the Infdev stage. The concept of a hell world re-surfaced when the development of Alpha 1.2.0 began, with the introduction of the Nether.

title: Minecraft Legends
summary: Minecraft Legends is an upcoming real-time action strategy video game being developed by Mojang Studios, Xbox Game Studios, and Blackbird Interactive. It is officially slated to release in Q1/Q2 2023.

title: Craft Your Own Adventure: Wild Tales
summary: The Craft Your Own Adventure: Wild Tales is a free Minecraft choose your own adventure story promoting The Wild Update. It is authored by Sofia Dankis, Cristina Anderca, Sophie Austin, and Per Landin. The story was published on June 4, 2022 through Twitter.

title: Slot
summary: A slot is a location in the data of a block entity or entity that an item stack can be placed in.

title: Disc Fragment
summary: A disc fragment is a music disc fragment obtained from ancient city loot chests. Nine fragments can be combined in a crafting table to make a music disc named "5".

title: How did we get here? (block)
summary: How did we get here? is a block introduced in 22w13oneBlockAtATime which converts all the items in the game with item blocks.

title: Echo Shard
summary: An echo shard is an item found in ancient cities which can be used to craft recovery compasses.

title: Recovery Compass
summary: A recovery compass is an item used to point to the location of the player's last death.

title: Muddy Mangrove Roots
summary: Muddy mangrove roots are a decorative variant of mangrove roots.

title: Mangrove Roots
summary: Mangrove roots are blocks that form as part of mangrove trees. Despite being a full block, they can be waterlogged.

title: Packed Mud
summary: Packed mud is a block crafted from mud and wheat. It is used to create mud bricks.

title: Mud Bricks
summary: Mud Bricks are a block obtained by crafting 4 packed mud.

title: Copper Horn
summary: A copper horn was an item crafted from a goat horn and copper ingots.

title: Chat
summary:
Chat is a messaging system used to communicate with other players, or to enter commands.
Several of these commands are configurable (the defaults are shown here).

title: Family
summary: A family is a unique technical label for Bedrock Edition, which specifies the family to which an mob or an entity belongs. The family of entity is defined in the entity components' minecraft:type_family. Families are used in commands such as target selector and create Add-on.

title: Translucency
summary: Translucency is a concept very closely related to transparency. Blocks, items, entities and other game elements said to be translucent allow for vision to pass through them partially, but not fully.

title: Code Builder Update
summary: The Code Builder Update, released as Education Edition 1.7, was a major update to Minecraft Education released on November 12, 2018, that added features equating to Update Aquatic (Phase 2) for Bedrock Edition (1.5.0).

title: Commands/warden spawn tracker
summary: Sets how many warnings a sculk shrieker will give before spawning a warden.

title: Reinforced Deepslate
summary: Reinforced deepslate is a block that spawns in ancient cities. It has high hardness, is immune to explosions and it cannot be obtained in Survival Mode.

title: Swift Sneak
summary: Swift Sneak is a non-renewable enchantment that can be applied to leggings and allows the player to walk more quickly while sneaking.

title: Michael Andersson
summary: Michael Andersson is a former Software Engineer who worked at Mojang Studios.

title: Photo
summary: A photo is an item containing a picture taken with a camera.

title: Commands/placefeature
summary: Places a configured feature at the specified location where meet the placement requirements.

title: Commands/takepicture
summary: /takepicture is a command used to take a photo of a player, or to take a photo from a player's point of view.

title: Simulation distance
summary: Simulation distance is a world-creation setting in Bedrock Edition that controls mob spawning and despawning, and tick updates. in Java Edition, simulation distance is a video setting related to render distance, to restrict tick update distance.

title: Commands/damage
summary: Apply damage to the specified entities.

title: Froglight
summary: A froglight is a light-emitting block that is obtained when a frog eats a tiny magma cube. It comes in three variants based on the variant of frog that eats the magma cube.

title: Item colors
summary: The following page lists colors which are applied to items in the game.

title: Block colors/Removed blocks and biomes
summary: This page covers block tints which were applied to blocks that no longer exist, as well as applications from biomes which also no longer exist.

title: Effect colors
summary: Effect colors refer to the combined concepts of colors applied to items and particles which are linked to potions and effects.

title: Spawn Egg colors
summary: Spawn eggs use textures which are accordingly colored to match each mob.

title: Miscellaneous colors
summary:
The following page lists colors which do not fit into any other category.
Note that this page only lists colors which are applied to textures - other colors such as sky and fog colors are not listed.

title: Block colors
summary: The following page lists colors which are applied to blocks and fluids in the world.

title: Client request placeholder block
summary: client_request_placeholder_block is an invisible block of unknown use.

title: Frogspawn
summary: Frogspawn is a non-solid block that hatches tadpoles. It is laid by frogs.

title: Minecraft Now
summary: Minecraft Now is a series of online livestreams produced by Mojang Studios, where development information regarding Minecraft is presented, alongside community creations, live gameplay, and a Q&A with the developers. The livestreams began with the first edition on December 9, 2021.

title: Guy
summary: Guy is a character in the novels Minecraft: The Island and Minecraft: The Mountain. He got his name from Summer, referencing his beard. The book references him being inside a video game after a dream about a "typing screen" meaning he could be a real person with no memory of reality or a sentient player.

title: El Fin the Archmage
summary: El Fin the Archmage or Fin is an enderman [spoiler](allegedly, but later finds out he is human wearing a carved pumpkin)(allegedly, but later finds out he is human wearing a carved pumpkin) in the novel Minecraft: The End.

title: Max
summary: Max is a twelve year old boy in the novel, Minecraft: The Lost Journals.

title: Alison
summary: Alison is a twelve or thirteen year old girl in the novel, Minecraft: The Lost Journals.

title: Jungle Bush
summary: A jungle bush is one of the rarest plants in the game, they generate in jungles and cannot be grown by jungle saplings.

title: Bedrock Developer Beta
summary: The Bedrock Developer Beta is a beta version of Bedrock Edition accessible only by developers and marketplace content creators. There hasn't been much documentation of the version.

title: Art style
summary:
These are art styles used in the Minecraft franchise:

Mini art, a chibi-like art style stylizing characters with small bodies and large heads
Pixel art, the pixelated art style used in mob votes
Plastic art, an art style with simple colors and a plastic look
Programmer art, the look of Minecraft before the Texture Update
Sketches, the look of pencil and paper used in concept art and the Mobestiary

title: Minecraft Antiquated Robot Inadequate Loves Lying Audaciously
summary:
The Minecraft Antiquated Robot Inadequate Loves Lying Audaciously, also known as MARILLA or M.A.R.I.L.L.A, is a character in the official Minecraft YouTube channel voiced by Marilla Wex.
She hosted the series Ten Things You Probably Didn't Know About Minecraft and then co-hosted The Secrets of Minecraft with Narrator from How We Make Minecraft.

title: Stygian Witch
summary: The three Stygian witches are mythological monsters in the Minecraft Mini-Series. They appeared in season 2 episode 2 in Medusa's Cave.

title: Sham
summary: The sham is a neutral monster in Minecraft Mini-Series. It first appeared in episode 4 on Eerie Island. It is also referred to as a haunted bed.

title: Well Wisher
summary: The Well Wisher is a undead vengeful spirit in the Minecraft Mini-Series. She first appeared in episode 3 as the main antagonist.

title: Enderall
summary: The enderall is a hostile and more powerful variant of the enderman in Minecraft Mini-Series. It first appeared in episode 5 in the Ender Cave on Scatter Island.

title: Dryad
summary: Dryads are mythological monsters, two of them were seen with chimera in the Minecraft Mini-Series. Two dryads first appeared in episode 5 of the second season.

title: Farm Monsters
summary: The farm monsters are hostile variants of cows, chickens, sheeps, pigs, and wolves in Minecraft Mini-Series.

title: Chimera
summary: The chimera is a mythological monster, he is part lion and snake creature. He gives the teams the challenge of beating him in theatrical performances with two dryads.

title: Toby
summary: Toby is a character in the Minecraft Mini-Series and part of Team Stone Beach with Quinn. He helps her in trying to escape CommuniKate's game show and then Poseidon's game show after he takes over in the Greek Isles.

title: Mo
summary: Mo is a character in the Minecraft Mini-Series and part of Team Mooshroom with Slugger.

title: Slugger
summary: Slugger is a character in the Minecraft Mini-Series and part of Team Mooshroom with Mo.

title: Sacha
summary: Sacha is a character in the Minecraft Mini-Series and part of Team Tundra with Rudi.

title: Rudi
summary: Rudi is a character in the Minecraft Mini-Series and is part of Team Tundra with Sacha.

title: Quinn
summary: Quinn is a female character in the Minecraft Mini-Series and part of Team Stone Beach with Toby. She helps everyone to try and escape CommuniKate's game show, winning a few minigames, and ultimately winning Season 1. She then teamed up with Durango, CommuniKate, and Zed in Season 2, The Greek Isles after Poseidon takes over.

title: River (Character)
summary: River is a character in the Minecraft Mini-Series and part of Team Mesa with Durango.

title: Durango
summary: Durango is a character in the Minecraft Mini-Series and part of Team Mesa with River (Character).

title: CommuniKate
summary: CommuniKate is a character and the "host" of the Minecraft Mini-Series.

title: Monolith
summary: Monoliths were glitched areas of terrain that happened in the later versions of Infdev and early Alpha eras of the game. These monoliths would cause the terrain to abruptly generate up to the height limit, with natural grass block and ore generation.

title: Green Shrub
summary: Green shrubs were variants of the grass block ID with block metadata with a value from 3 to 15 inclusive in Java Edition. Unlike the intentionally-implemented shrub, their color changed depending on the biome.

title: Mobs of Minecraft
summary: Mobs of Minecraft is a series of children's books written by Christy Webster and illustrated by Alan Batson. Each book includes a press-out foldable figure of the mob featured.

title: Water lake
summary: A water lake was a small body of water source blocks in the Overworld. It could generate both on the surface and underground, in the latter case an air pocket would generate above it.

title: Ice Patch
summary: Ice patches are blobs of packed ice that generate exclusively in the ice spikes biome.

title: Weird Piston
summary: Weird pistons were extreme metadata variants of pistons which could be used as update suppression agents.

title: Content inaccessible in Survival
summary: There are many elements in Minecraft that are completely inaccessible to the player in Survival mode.

title: Tadpole
summary: A tadpole is the larval form of the frog. They mature into one of the three frog variants, depending on the biome in which they mature.

title: Mangrove
summary: Mangrove trees are found in mangrove swamps, in which they can grow on water or land. They have large canopies and aerial root systems. Their wood color is vermillion. They can be planted in the air, but their roots always touch the ground.

title: Boat with Chest
summary: A boat with chest is a single chest occupying the passenger seat of a boat, and functions as such. As it can still be driven it can be used to transport items over bodies of water.

title: Taxicab distance
summary: Taxicab distance, also known as rectilinear distance, city block distance, Manhattan distance, and other names, is a metric in taxicab geometry for measuring distance, as an alternative to Euclidean distance (straight-line, or "as the crow flies"). Minecraft uses taxicab distance as an efficient range measurement in several elements of the game.

title: Allay
summary: The allay ( /əˈleɪ/ uh-ʟᴀʏ) is a small flying passive mob. It collects and delivers items for any player that gives it something, or any note block it hears repeatedly playing.

title: Sky
summary: The sky is a visual feature of Minecraft worlds.

title: Minecraft (franchise)
summary: Minecraft as a franchise refers to the many appearances of Minecraft characters or references, as well as the "Minecraft" word itself, through official games and media released by Mojang Studios.

title: GOAT Update
summary: The GOAT Update was a major update to Minecraft Education. Development for this update started with beta Education Edition 1.17.30.2. This update brought the Nether Update and Caves & Cliffs: Part I features to Education Edition, as well as Flipgrid and Microsoft Teams integrations. Education Edition 1.17.30 was released on November 2, 2021.

title: Commands/jfr
summary: Start profiling with Java FlightRecorder as well as a few custom events.

title: Minecraft Card Game
summary: The Minecraft Card Game is a card game published by Mojang Studios and Mattel Games. In the game, players "mine" resource cards so they can be used to "craft" craft cards, which in turn can be used to "craft" tools to collect points.

title: Sculk Shrieker
summary: A sculk shrieker is a sculk block found in the deep dark biome that produces a "shrieking" noise when a player either stands on it (regardless of sneaking) or triggers a nearby sculk sensor. Shriekers found in the deep dark can summon the warden when they are triggered.

title: Background
summary: The background is a decorative background of a GUI displayed in the options, end poem, etc.

title: Smiling Creeper
summary: The smiling creeper was a hostile mob present in the April Fool's Love and Hugs Update.

title: Love Golem
summary: The love golem was a utility mob present in the April Fool's Love and Hugs Update. It was a manifestation of the villager's love.

title: Minecraft (Step into Reading series)
summary: Minecraft is a series of children's books written by Nick Eliopulos and illustrated by Alan Batson. Each book includes a set of thirty stickers.

title: Developer version
summary: A developer build, in contrast to a development version, is a version of Minecraft which is in the process of being developed, and is not intended to be publicly playable. Unlike development versions, developer versions seldom make it into the hands of non-Mojang parties, and those that do are generally the result of leaks.

title: Caves & Cliffs Prototype Data Pack
summary: The Caves & Cliffs Prototype Data Pack is an official data pack that was released periodically by Mojang Studios from April 2021 to May 2021. It contains several experimental and work-in-progress features, most of which were eventually released in Java Edition 1.18. Its first release coincided with the announcement that Caves & Cliffs would be split into two major updates. The data pack was eventually superseded by experimental snapshots as changes that are too large for a data pack were introduced.

title: Zombie Town
summary: Zombie Town is an unreleased game that Markus Persson (Notch) was developing around February of 2009. The game's characters were adopted as the default player skin of another project Notch would work on a few months later.

title: Procedural animated texture generation/Nether portals
summary:
Due to the large number of Atan2 and Sine operations, all frames of animation (a total of 32, at a resolution of 16×16) for the portal block are generated once at-startup and stored into an internal animation strip; The random shimmer is the same every time, as the game always uses a random number generator with a seed of 100L.
To generate one frame of the nether portal animation:

The portal block is the only one of the procedural textures that is ported 1:1 in the 1.5 resource pack changes; Unlike the water animations, the alpha channel was not made uniform in the 1.15 texture update.

title: Ancient City
summary: An Ancient City is a palatial structure found in deep dark biomes at layer -51, harboring chests containing some items that cannot be found anywhere else.

title: Meadow
summary: The meadow is an elevated grassy biome filled with patches of flowers and turquoise-green grass and tall grass, where sheep, donkeys and rabbits spawn.

title: Commands/dialogue
summary: Used to open the NPC dialogue to the player and change the dialogue displayed by an NPC.

title: Procedural animated texture generation
summary:
Prior to Java Edition 1.5 snapshot 13w02a, the textures for animated blocks were generated on-the-fly using certain algorithms, rather than being defined image files.
In cases such as when the texture could not be loaded, dedicated placeholder textures would be loaded instead.

title: List of mob textures
summary: This page serves as a compact list of all unique mob and entity textures or skins which have ever existed in officially released versions of Minecraft.

title: Commands/perf
summary:
Captures information and metrics about the game for ten seconds.
Note that this command can only executed in dedicated server, use F3 + L in client to run performance profiler.

title: List of item textures
summary: This page serves as a compact list of all unique item textures which have ever existed in officially released versions of Minecraft.

title: Structure Air
summary: Structure air is an invisible block of unknown use.

title: Animation names
summary: This page is a list of animation names for use with the /playanimation command. These can be found in the vanilla resource pack folder under animations.

title: MinecraftEdu mod 0.1
summary: 0.1 was the first released version of MinecraftEdu. It is based on Java Edition Beta 1.6.6.

title: Banner (image)
summary: A banner is an image, usually a game screenshot, released alongside a development version or game release.

title: Air Wizard
summary: The Air Wizard is the first boss of Minicraft. It can be found in the Sky World and has 2,000 health. Touching it or its ranged attack deals one point of damage to the player. Its ranged attacks can attack other mobs other than the player.

title: Logo
summary: The Minecraft logo is used in its many forms to represent its franchise and the game.

title: Al version
summary: al_version (AppletLoader version) is a number used in versions prior to Java Edition Alpha to uniquely identify a client version of the game.

title: Camps & Clubs
summary: Camps & Clubs is an update for Education Edition. Development for this update started with beta Education Edition 1.14.60. This update expands eligibility to camps, after-school programs, homeschools, nonprofits and other organizations. Education Edition 1.14.70 was released on May 26, 2021.

title: Blob
summary: A blob is a feature consisting of basalt or blackstone blocks.

title: Commands/closewebsocket
summary: Disconnects from the WebSocket server.

title: Commands/agent
summary:
/agent is a command used to control an agent.
Agent control commands are only allowed to be executed by the WebSocket side to which the player is connected, and the player cannot execute the command directly in the game.

title: Marker
summary: Markers are entities intended for use in data packs and map-making. They can only be created with the /summon command.

title: Block of Raw Iron
summary: A block of raw iron is a raw metal block equivalent to nine raw iron.

title: Block of Raw Copper
summary: A block of raw copper is a raw metal block equivalent to nine raw copper.

title: Block of Raw Gold
summary: A block of raw gold is a raw metal block equivalent to nine raw gold.

title: Brickcraft
summary: From September 5, 2011 to July 19, 2012, Mojang was co-developing a video game titled Brickcraft (codenamed "Project Rex Kwon Do") alongside The Lego Group.

title: Raw Gold
summary: Raw gold is a raw metal resource obtained from mining gold ore.

title: Raw Copper
summary: Raw copper is a raw metal resource obtained from mining copper ore.

title: Raw Iron
summary: Raw iron is a raw metal resource obtained from mining iron ore.

title: Minecraft Plus!
summary: Minecraft Plus! is a screensaver app developed by Mojang Studios for April Fools Day 2021. It features many different Minecraft-themed screen savers, using block and item textures from the game, inspired by screensavers from old computers. The app is available to download for free and runs on 64-bit Windows 7+ PCs. Alternatively, the app can also be used in a modern web browser.

title: Quinn Richter
summary: Quinn Richter is an Associate Producer at Mojang Studios, working as Head of the Minecraft Marketplace Program.

title: Renewability
summary: Renewability refers to the possibility of an item or block to be obtained continuously without exploring new areas.

title: Debug fourj item
summary: debug_fourj_item is an unobtainable item exclusive to the Legacy Console Edition and can only be obtained through modding the game.

title: List of minerals
summary: The entries on this alphabetized list of minerals all are blocks and items in the game that share a name with real-world minerals.

title: List of sediments
summary: The entries in this list of sediments are all the blocks that share names with real-world sediments.

title: Oleg Kozitsyn
summary: Oleg Kozitsyn is a Tech Co-lead of the UI team at Mojang Studios.

title: Jonas Bergström
summary:
Jonas Bergström is a back-end developer and software architect at Mojang Studios.
He develops and operates on back-end systems and APIs that support Minecraft, Jonas has worked at Mojang since 2018.

title: Klas Hammarström
summary: Klas Hammarström is a Production Manager at Mojang Studios.

title: Márcio Oliveira
summary: Márcio Oliveira is a Senior Developer for Bedrock Edition at Mojang Studios.

title: David Fries
summary: David Fries is Release Management Lead at Mojang Studios in Washington, U.S.

title: Forest rock/Structure
summary:
A forest rock is a small structure found throughout giant tree taiga biomes.
This page comments about one of them,there are many other variations.

title: Mariana Salimena
summary: Mariana Salimena Pires is a concept artist at Mojang Studios in Stockholm, Sweden. Salimena joined Mojang in January 2020 and is graduated in arts by the Federal University of Juiz de Fora in Minas Gerais state from Brazil.

title: Minecraft Novels
summary: The Minecraft Official Novels are a series of novels for Minecraft. The novels are written by various authors.

title: List of painting textures
summary: This page serves as a compact list of all unique painting textures which have ever existed in officially released versions of Minecraft.

title: Play Mechanix
summary: Play Mechanix is an American arcade game entertainment company based in Skokie, Illinois, best known for the Big Buck Hunter series of arcade games. The company is responsible for developing Minecraft Dungeons Arcade alongside Mojang Studios.

title: List of particle textures
summary: This page serves as a compact list of all unique particle textures which have ever existed in officially released versions of Minecraft.

title: New Nintendo 3DS Edition history of textures/Paintings
summary: This page documents the history of painting textures in New Nintendo 3DS Edition.

title: Pi Edition history of textures
summary: This page documents the history of texture files used in Pi Edition.

title: New Nintendo 3DS Edition history of textures
summary: This page documents the history of texture files used in New Nintendo 3DS Edition.

title: Items-opaque.tga
summary: items-opaque.tga was a texture atlas found inside minecraft.apk used for storing textures of items.

title: Toasts
summary: Toasts are text boxes shown when the player unlocks new crafting recipes or loads up a new world. They serve as a tutorial, to teach the player how to play the game. They show up in the top right corner of the screen.

title: Cobbled Deepslate
summary: Cobbled deepslate is a stone variant that functions similar to cobblestone or blackstone.

title: Unknown
summary: Unknown is a placeholder block exclusive to Bedrock Edition that generates in place where blocks have an invalid ID.

title: Commands/geteduserverinfo
summary: Returns information about the server.

title: The Wild Update
summary: The Wild Update is a major update released on June 7, 2022, as Java Edition 1.19 and Bedrock Edition 1.19.0, themed around "scary things" and natural wilderness.

title: Commands/gametest
summary: /gametest is a server-side test automation tool that is based on pairing test code with test structures.

title: Commands/wipeout
summary: Clear all non-player entities in all dimensions

title: Commands/tptosuitabletree
summary: Returns a position where the player can destroy a tree.

title: Commands/villages
summary: Enable/disable village debugging information display

title: Commands/stoptime
summary: Stop/continue time.

title: Commands/testassets
summary: Upload/download a test resource through Test Manager.

title: Commands/timelock
summary: Stop/continue time.

title: Commands/test
summary: Execute a test with Test Manager.

title: Commands/systemstat
summary: Return or set the running statistics of the game.

title: Commands/spawnmob
summary: Generate an entity with/without specific components.

title: Commands/spawnitem
summary: Generate a entity of the item at a specific coordinate.

title: Commands/spawning
summary: Set whether the entity can spawn naturally

title: Commands/simlock
summary: Lock the simulation time.

title: Commands/spawnfeature
summary: Generate relic structure

title: Commands/simscale
summary: Scale the simulating passage.

title: Commands/skin
summary: Get the name of the player's current skin.

title: Commands/setskin
summary: Set player skin

title: Commands/setviewdistance
summary: Set view distance

title: Commands/setguiscale
summary: Set GUI scale

title: Commands/setbrightness
summary: Set the brightness level

title: Commands/sendshowstoreoffer
summary: Send a request to show players the store offer

title: Commands/sendmodalform
summary: Make a request to the specified player to display the form to them

title: Commands/selectinventoryitem
summary: Select specific items from the player's nine hotbar slots

title: Commands/rot
summary: Set the player's current rotation angle

title: Commands/profile
summary: Get player profile

title: Commands/register3pserver
summary: Register a third-party server in the third-party server's repository.

title: Commands/placefromhand
summary: If possible, place the blocks in your hand to the specified coordinates

title: Commands/pause
summary: Simulate the action of the player pressing the pause button and enter the pause screen

title: Commands/paths
summary: Enable/disable pathfinding display

title: Commands/redstonetest
summary: Export redstone image to Visual Studio

title: Commands/playerstat

title: Deepslate
summary: Deepslate is a stone type found deep underground in the Overworld that functions similarly to regular stone, but is significantly more difficult to break.

title: Clay blob
summary: Clay blobs were a terrain feature that existed as a way for clay blocks to generate naturally.

title: Teleport Block
summary: Teleport block is a block used to teleport.

title: Foundation block
summary: The foundation block was a block used to measure distances.

title: Home Block
summary: Home block is a block used to teleport players to their home.

title: Block Inspector
summary: Block Inspector is an item used to display the name of the block the player is looking at on screen.

title: Information Sign
summary: Information sign was a decorative block used to inform nearby students about something.

title: Big Sign
summary: Big Sign is a three block wide sign.

title: Developer commands
summary: Developer commands are generally only enabled in the development and testing environment of the game.

title: Small Dripleaf
summary: A  small dripleaf is a plant which generates in lush caves, and is used to grow big dripleaves, a platforming block.

title: Big Dripleaf
summary: A big dripleaf is a plant that generates within lush caves. It may be used as a block for parkour and platforming.

title: Moss Block
summary: A moss block is a natural block that can be spread to some other blocks by using bone meal.

title: Hanging Roots
summary: Hanging roots are a natural decorative block found underground in the lush caves biome.

title: Moss Carpet
summary: A moss carpet is a thin decorative variant of the moss block.

title: Effect (dimension)
summary: In custom dimensions, an effect is a set of rendering features utilised for defining a dimension's atmosphere and visuals.

title: Noise generator
summary: Minecraft uses several different types of noise generators, specifically those making use of gradient noise, for the generation of terrain alongside other features.

title: Custom feature
summary: Features are small decorations that can at most write to a 3×3 chunk area centered on the placement chunk. They're locally placed per-chunk and cannot be searched for using commands. Examples are trees, flowers, ore, etc.

title: Glow Ink Sac
summary: A glow ink sac is an item dropped by a glow squid upon death. Unlike regular ink sacs, it can be added to signs to make glowing text, and can be used to craft glow item frames.

title: Glow Lichen
summary: A glow lichen is a non-solid, light-emitting block. It can generate, or be placed, on any side of a solid block.

title: Panorama
summary: The panorama (also known as the cubemap) is a slowly panning wide-angle view of a Minecraft world displayed on the main menu.

title: Dripstone (feature)
summary: Dripstone features can be found commonly in dripstone caves biomes. There are three types of dripstone feature: Large Dripstone, Dripstone Cluster and Pointed Dripstone (aka. Small Dripstone).

title: Redstone mechanics
summary: Redstone mechanics provide Minecraft with a loose analogue to electricity, which is useful for controlling and activating a variety of mechanisms.

title: Spawn protection
summary: Spawn protection prevents players from building in spawn, undoing any attempts at placing or breaking blocks.

title: Placeholder texture
summary: Minecraft uses an assortment of different placeholder textures for handling cases where textures cannot be drawn normally.

title: Removed blocks
summary: This page documents blocks which existed in any of the game's several editions, but are no longer present in the latest version.

title: Community Celebration
summary: Community Celebration was an event that took place between December 8, 2020 and January 13, 2021. During the event, players were able to claim and download four maps made by the community for free, as well as new character creator items, for Bedrock Edition. Players on Java Edition were also able to redeem free content, as well as a free week of Realms. The content was made by community creators PixelHeads, Noxcrew, Gamemode One, Mithey, and Jigarbov Productions. Mojang Studios ran the event in order to thank the community for investing time and talent into the game.

title: Create New World
summary: The "Create New World" screen is a menu screen that allows the player to create a new world.

title: David Carlton
summary: David Carlton, also known as CornerHard is a Mojang game developer. He was a developer of the Bedrock Edition software. He is now the technical lead for the Realms client.

title: History of leaf decay
summary: This page documents Java Edition​'s several historical leaf decay algorithms.

title: Minecraft MakeCode
summary: Minecraft MakeCode is a version of Microsoft MakeCode designed for Minecraft Education. it allows the player to program the Agent and in-game events using "Blocks" (a block-based programming interface), Python or JavaScript.

title: Torch (Burnt-out)
summary: The torch (burnt-out) is a joke feature introduced exclusively in Java Edition 2.0. After a normal torch burns out, the burnt-out torch appears.

title: Leftover
summary: The leftover is a block introduced in Java Edition 20w14∞ that forms the "zones" in the "zones" dimension.

title: Screen effects
summary: Screen effects encompass a variety of effects applied alongside or beneath the heads-up display as augmentations to the player's point of view as a method of conveying further information about a player's current state.

title: Item modifier
summary: Item modifiers are technical JSON files that can be created inside data packs and are used to add loot functions into existing items using the command /item.

title: Commands/item
summary: Manipulate or copy items in the inventories of blocks (chest, furnaces, etc.) or entities (players or mobs).

title: Powder Snow Bucket
summary: A powder snow bucket is a bucket with powder snow inside.

title: Azalea tree
summary: An azalea tree is a rare tree that can generate above a lush cave biome, marking the biome's presence aboveground. A variant of the usual oak tree, they extend their roots underground into the cave beneath.

title: Azalea
summary:
An azalea is a solid block that can be grown into an azalea tree.
A flowering azalea is a variant of azalea that, additionally, counts as a flower for all purposes, including pollination by bees, except crafting dyes.

title: Calcite
summary: Calcite is a carbonate mineral, currently used as a decorative block.

title: Tuff
summary: Tuff is an ornamental rock formed from volcanic ash, occurring in underground blobs below Y=16.

title: Budding Amethyst
summary: Budding amethyst is a fragile block found in amethyst geodes that grows amethyst clusters over time. It cannot be obtained as an item or moved by a piston, necessitating that it be returned to in order to harvest more clusters from it.

title: Candle
summary: A candle is a block that comes in any of the sixteen dye colors, as well as an undyed variant. Candles are placed unlit and can be lit with flint and steel to provide light and extinguished by being used. Up to four of the same color of candle can be placed in one block space, which affects the amount of light produced.

title: Block of Amethyst
summary: A block of amethyst is a decorative block crafted from four amethyst shards.

title: Copper Ingot
summary: Copper ingots are metal ingots obtained from smelting raw copper or killing drowned.

title: Social interactions
summary: The Social Interactions screen is a graphical interface used to disable chatting with certain players.

title: Procedural animated texture generation/Gears
summary: Code which generates the frames of the gear texture can be found here.

title: Grass carried
summary: grass_carried was a block which was used for storing the item model for grass blocks.

title: Leaves carried
summary: leaves_carried was a block which was used for storing the item model for leaves.

title: Dripstone Block
summary: The dripstone block is a rock block that allows pointed dripstone to grow beneath it.

title: Nerd Creeper
summary: The nerd creeper was a hostile creeper-based mob present in the April Fool's Java Edition 3D Shareware v1.34 update.

title: Brandon Pearce
summary: Brandon "kingbdogz" Pearce is a Mojang Studios employee currently working as a gameplay developer at the headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden.

title: Sculk Vein
summary: A sculk vein is a block found in the deep dark or generated by sculk catalysts. It can generate or be placed on any side of a solid block.

title: Sculk Catalyst
summary: A sculk catalyst is a block that converts blocks around it to blocks in the sculk family (except for more sculk catalysts) when a mob that drops experience dies nearby.

title: History of textures
summary:
This page intends to document the history of textures used in Minecraft.
For more in depth information for actually used textures for each edition, refer to the following pages:

Java Edition history of textures
Bedrock Edition history of textures
Minecraft Education history of textures
Legacy Console Edition history of textures
New Nintendo 3DS Edition history of textures
Pi Edition history of textures

title: Rooted Dirt
summary: Rooted dirt is a natural decorative block.

title: Spyglass
summary: A spyglass is a tool used to zoom in on distant objects.

title: Deep Dark
summary: The deep dark is a cave biome that generates deep underground in the Overworld.

title: Pointed Dripstone
summary:
Pointed dripstone is a block that makes up stalactites and stalagmites. 
Stalactites (which point downward) can be used as falling projectiles, to renewably drip water and lava into cauldrons and to convert mud into clay. 
Stalagmites (which point upward) deal extra damage to players and mobs that land on them.

title: Amethyst Cluster
summary:
Amethyst buds are the first three stages of growth of amethyst clusters, which grow on budding amethyst.
Amethyst clusters are the fourth and final growth stage of amethyst buds, which drop amethyst shards when mined.

title: Amethyst geode
summary: An amethyst geode is a feature found in the underground of the Overworld. Amethyst geodes contain smooth basalt, calcite, and are the main source of amethyst items and blocks.

title: Block of Copper
summary: The block of copper and cut copper are blocks that oxidize over time, gaining a verdigris appearance over four stages. They can be prevented from oxidising by being waxed with honeycombs. Non-cut, non-oxidised, non-waxed copper blocks are storage blocks equivalent to nine copper ingots.

title: Copper Ore
summary:
Copper ore is a mineral block found underground.
Deepslate copper ore is the deepslate variant of copper ore, usually found deeper underground.

title: Amethyst Shard
summary: An amethyst shard is a crystal obtained from mining a fully grown amethyst cluster or can be obtained from chests in ancient cities.

title: Bundle
summary: A bundle is a storage item that can be used for managing items inside the player's inventory, and allows for combination of multiple item types within single inventory slots.

title: Dripstone Caves
summary: The dripstone caves biome is an Overworld cave biome filled with clusters and pillars of pointed dripstone and dripstone blocks.

title: Sculk
summary: Sculk is a block found abundantly in the deep dark or converted from other blocks by a sculk catalyst. Like most of the rest of the sculk family it drops experience when broken by a tool that is not enchanted with Silk Touch.

title: Sculk Sensor
summary: The sculk sensor is a sculk block that detects vibrations caused by actions and events and emits a redstone signal and triggers nearby sculk shriekers. Players can sneak to avoid making vibrations and wool can be used to occlude and block them.

title: Glow Berries
summary:
Glow berries are a food item that is collected from cave vines and can be used to plant them.
Cave vines are a plant used to grow glow berries.

title: Warden
summary: The warden is a hostile mob summoned by sculk shriekers in deep dark biomes. It has the highest health and deals the highest melee damage of all mobs. It can also fire ranged sonic boom attacks that bypass blocks and almost all damage-reducing items, including enchanted armor. The warden is completely blind and relies on vibrations and its sense of smell to detect players and mobs to attack.

title: Spore Blossom
summary: A spore blossom is a ceiling-hanging decorative block that emits green particles.

title: Lush Caves
summary: A lush cave is a temperate Overworld cave biome that has a unique fauna and flora and is found underground below azalea trees.

title: Caves & Cliffs
summary: Caves & Cliffs is the name of two major themed updates for Java and Bedrock editions.

title: Commands/fly
summary: Toggles flying.

title: Super Smash Bros. Ultimate
summary: Super Smash Bros.

title: Saxs
summary: Saxs is an employee working for Mojang Studios. He is working on Minecraft. He is the Chief Creative Officer for Minecraft Earth.

title: Commands/music
summary: Allows the player to control playing music tracks.

title: Spawn Block
summary: Spawn Block is block that can be used to set the spawn point.

title: Information block
summary: Information block is a block that can be used by the teacher in MinecraftEdu to write text.

summary: 1.0.11 was a version of Nintendo Switch Edition released on December 19, 2017.

summary: Used to trigger an event on an entity.

summary: Used to remove spawnpoints in the world.

summary: Used to enable a camera shaking effect if the player has camera shake toggled (in Accessibility settings).

title: List of block textures
summary: This page serves as a compact list of all unique block textures which have ever existed in officially released versions of Minecraft.

title: Terrain-atlas.tga
summary: terrain-atlas.tga and the mipmap variants terrain-atlas_mip0.tga, terrain-atlas_mip1.tga, terrain-atlas_mip2.tga and terrain-atlas_mip3.tga were texture atlases found inside minecraft.apk that were used to load the game's block textures.

title: Cursor
summary: The cursor is a block introduced in Java Edition 20w14∞ with an animated texture that changes its color every second, toggling between lime and black concrete.

title: Nintendo Switch Edition 1.0.12
summary: 1.0.12 was a version of Nintendo Switch Edition released on January 30, 2018.

title: Nintendo Switch Edition 1.0.13
summary: 1.0.13 was a version of Nintendo Switch Edition released on March 27, 2018.

title: Nintendo Switch Edition 1.0.14
summary: 1.0.14 was a version of Nintendo Switch Edition released on April 24, 2018.

title: Nintendo Switch Edition 1.0.15
summary: 1.0.15 was a version of Nintendo Switch Edition released on May 29, 2018.

title: Nintendo Switch Edition 1.0.17
summary: 1.0.17 was a version of Nintendo Switch Edition released on June 21, 2018.

title: Nintendo Switch Edition 1.0.6
summary: 1.0.6 was a version of Nintendo Switch Edition released on July 25, 2017.

title: Nintendo Switch Edition 1.0.9
summary: 1.0.9 was a version of Nintendo Switch Edition released on November 14, 2017.

title: Minecraft Preview
summary:
Minecraft Preview is an app players can use to test out beta features from Bedrock Edition. It works as a separate app, rather than the previous system of opt in beta content inside of the Bedrock Edition game itself. 
As of now, it is currently available for Windows and Xbox, as well as limited users on iOS and iPadOS.

title: Commands/clearinventory
summary: Clears the player's inventory.

title: Commands/cleanroom
summary: Deletes all entities excluding the player. Effectively a combination of the /wipeout and /spawning commands.

title: Commands/clearslot
summary: Clears a specified slot of a specified entity.

title: Commands/bounds
summary: Toggles the rendering of bounding boxes and volume drawing.

title: Commands/bhave
summary: Runs a behavior tree.

title: Commands/automatemoveto
summary: Runs a MoveTo behavior tree.

title: Commands/automateplaceblock
summary: Runs a PlaceBlock behavior tree.

summary: Runs a GetInteractionPositionForBlock behavior tree.

title: Commands/automatelookat
summary: Runs a LookAt behavior tree.

title: Commands/automatemove
summary: Runs a Move behavior tree.

title: Commands/automatefly
summary: Runs a Fly behavior tree.

title: Commands/automatefindblock
summary: Runs a FindBlock behavior tree.

title: Commands/automatebreakblock
summary: Runs a BreakBlock behavior tree.

title: Commands/automateactivetool
summary: Runs an ActiveTool behavior tree.

title: Commands/automate
summary: Runs a behavior tree.

title: Commands/aigoals
summary: Toggles the display of AI and pathfinding info of mobs.

title: Minecraft Live 2022
summary: Minecraft Live 2022 was a live event held on October 15, 2022, at 16:00 UTC. It announced Java Edition 1.20 and Bedrock Edition 1.20.0, the next update after The Wild Update, and contained a mob vote in which the sniffer won over the other two mobs, the rascal and the tuff golem.

title: Commands/fog
summary: Used for managing active fog settings for players.

title: Adele Major
summary: Adele Major is an Executive Producer at Mojang Studios.

title: Commands/listd
summary: Lists detail infomation about players on the server.

title: Commands/permission
summary:
Lists or reloads permission list.
Can be executed only in BDS console.

title: Commands/changesetting
summary:
Changes a setting on the dedicated server (BDS) while it's running.
Can be executed only on BDS console.

title: Commands/playanimation
summary: Makes one or more entities play a one-off animation.

title: Commands/ride
summary: Allows entities to mount or dismount other entities.

title: Commands/structure
summary: Used to save and load structures without having to use structure blocks.

title: Andy Hill
summary: Andy 'Needsmoreclever' Hill is a member of the Minecraft and RenderDragon development teams at Mojang Studios. He also hosted the official Minecraft livestreams Join the Club and Casual Friday. He appeared at multiple Minefaire events throughout the US representing Mojang Studios.

title: Peter Hont
summary: Peter Hont is a Mojang Studios employee who helped compose the music for Minecraft Dungeons, both for the Mainland levels and all current DLC levels. He is famous for his Minecraft Dungeons: Original Game Soundtrack album.

title: Minecraft Genoa
summary: Minecraft Genoa was the first phase in the development cycle of Minecraft Earth. Minecraft Genoa development was started in 2014 and was phased out favor of Minecraft Earth Beta in 2019.

title: Minecraft Live 2021
summary: Minecraft Live 2021 was a live event held on October 16, 2021, at 16:00 UTC. It announced The Wild Update, the next update after Caves & Cliffs: Part II, and contained a mob vote in which the allay won.

title: Village mechanics/Before Village & Pillage
summary: This page describes mechanics relating to villages and villagers in Java Edition 1.13.2 and Bedrock Edition 1.7.1.

title: Henning Erlandsen
summary: Henning Erlandsen is a game developer at Mojang Studios.

title: List of renewable resources
summary: Renewable resources that can be obtained through methods other than trading or rare drops.

title: Small island
summary: A small island (aka. end island) is roughly a hemispherical cluster of end stone blocks found within its respective biome.

title: Texture atlas
summary: A texture atlas, also known as a spritesheet, is an arrangement of game sprites on a single image file, used by the game to store and access associated sprites more efficiently than with individual files. Minecraft uses both procedurally-generated and predefined texture atlases for different purposes.

title: Custom structure
summary: Structures (aka structure features) are a special type of feature that generates a structure.

title: Configured surface builder
summary: Surface builders control how the surface of the terrain is shaped and what blocks it is generated with. Configured surface builders are stored as JSON files within a data pack in the path data/<namespace>/worldgen/configured_surface_builder. They are used in world generation.

title: Custom world generation
summary: Custom world generation allows data packs to change how the world generate.

title: Custom biome
summary: Biomes stored as JSON files within a data pack in the path data/<namespace>/worldgen/biome.

title: Character
summary: The term  character refers to mobs, skins, heroes, and other entities that have an official character name or title, including the official mascots characters. The following list of titles are in order of release.

title: Piglin Brute
summary: A piglin brute is a hostile and stronger variant of piglins that appears in all types of bastion remnants. They always attack the player. They do not barter, they do not retreat, and they cannot be distracted by gold.

title: Niklas Börestam
summary: Niklas Börestam is the Tech Lead & Development Manager of Minecraft Dungeons.

title: Laura de Llorens Garcia
summary:
Laura de Llorens Garcia is a game designer on Minecraft Dungeons at Mojang Studios.
Laura is from Barcelona and currently works in Sweden.

title: Block update
summary: A block update is an in-game mechanism that occurs when a block is modified in some way.

title: Powder Snow
summary: Powder snow is a block found in snowy slopes and grove biomes, or collected from snowfall using cauldrons.  Players and most mobs fall through powder snow and take freezing damage within it, but leather boots can be worn to stand on and climb through it as well as gain freezing immunity. Powder snow can only be obtained using a bucket.

title: Lightning Rod
summary: A lightning rod is a block used to divert lightning strikes.

title: Custom dimension
summary: Dimensions are JSON files located in data packs that define dimensions for the game. New dimensions added can be accessed currently only by using commands, like /execute in <dimension> run teleport <coordinates>.

title: Item components
summary:
JSON formatted.
Like NBT tags but supports only minecraft:can_place_on,minecraft:can_destroy,minecraft:item_lock and minecraft:keep_on_death functions.

title: Minecraft Store
summary: The Minecraft store was a joke site created by Notch for April Fools' 2011.

title: Darkness
summary: Darkness is a status effect that causes the player's vision to temporarily deteriorate. The effect is caused by the activation of a sculk shrieker, or by being within detection range of a warden.

title: Goat Horn
summary: A goat horn is an item dropped by goats. It has eight variants, and each plays a unique sound when used which can be heard by players in a large radius.

title: Mud
summary: Mud is a block found abundantly in mangrove swamps or created by using a water bottle on a dirt block. It can be used for crafting or converted into clay using pointed dripstone.

title: Void start platform
summary: Void start platforms are a feature of 33×33 square of stone with a single block of cobblestone in the center. One can generate at the origin of a Superflat world if in the_void biome.

title: Redstone Bug
summary: A redstone bug was a hostile mob present in Java Edition 2.0, similar in form to a silverfish.

title: Aquatic
summary: The term Aquatic refers to an in-game group of mobs that live in oceans and rivers and are able to swim.

title: Commands/executedetect
summary: Executes another command if the block at the specified position matches the specified block type and data.

title: Commands/tptoplayer
summary: Teleports your agent to your feet.

title: Felix Jones
summary: Felix Jones, whose artistic name is Xilefian ( /ˈzaɪleˌfiːən/ ZY-leh-fee-ən), is a Minecraft game developer at Mojang Studios and the tech lead for Minecraft Bedrock Edition gameplay. He joined the Minecraft team in January 2020.

title: Animation
summary: An animation is a change in appearance of something with respect to time, used in order to convey information or for aesthetic purposes.

title: Hitbox
summary: A hitbox defines the physical "boundaries" (or an approximation thereof) of a block or entity.

title: NBT path format
summary: An NBT path is a descriptive label used to specify a collection of particular elements from an NBT data tree. A path has the general form node.….node, where each node declares what types of sub-elements can be chosen from a previous tag.

title: Loading world screen
summary: The loading world screen is a screen displayed when generating or loading a world. It shows the percentage of the loading progress.

title: Emotes
summary: Emotes are a part of the character creator that allows players to perform animations.

title: Ruined portal/Structure
summary:
Note: Some blocks may be added, replaced or removed during the actual generation, see Ruined Portal#Generation for more info.
To make the Nether version, replace iron bars with chains and stone blocks with blackstone variants (normal stone with polished blackstone).

title: Optimize world
summary: The optimize world screen is a game menu that is used to upgrade the level data of a world to the latest format. If the player optimizes a world, it is no longer compatible with previous versions of the game.

title: Commands/attribute
summary: Used to change or read attributes.

title: Basalt columns
summary: Basalt columns are vertical clusters of basalt blocks found within basalt delta biomes. They may also contain lava and magma in the many gaps between the towers.

title: Delta
summary: A delta is one-block-deep sheets of constrained lava found among the terrain of basalt deltas biomes.

title: Ruined portal
summary: A ruined portal is a naturally generated damaged nether portal, which spawns in both the Nether and the Overworld. It contains some decoration and a loot chest around it.

title: Lena Raine
summary: Lena Raine (/ˈleɪ.nə/ LAY-nuh or /ˈlɛ.nə/ LEN-uh), also known as Lena Chappelle or kuraine, is a composer, producer, and video game developer who composed tracks for the Nether Update, Caves & Cliffs Part II, and The Wild Update. All of these songs are featured in her albums Minecraft: Nether Update (Original Game Soundtrack), Minecraft:  Caves & Cliffs (Original Game Soundtrack), and Minecraft:  The Wild Update (Original Game Soundtrack). Outside of Minecraft Raine is known for creating the soundtracks of games such as Celeste, Deltarune, Guild Wars 2 and Chicory: A  Colorful Tale.

title: Gilded Blackstone
summary: Gilded blackstone is a variant of blackstone that can drop itself or gold nuggets when mined.

title: Polished Blackstone Bricks
summary:
Polished blackstone bricks are a decorative version of polished blackstone.
 Cracked polished blackstone bricks is the cracked version of polished blackstone bricks.

title: Polished Blackstone
summary:
Polished blackstone is the stone-like polished variation of blackstone.
 Chiseled polished blackstone is the chiseled variation of polished blackstone.

title: Blackstone
summary: Blackstone is a dark-colored block that functions similar to cobblestone or cobbled deepslate. It can be found only in the Nether.

title: Basalt Deltas
summary: The basalt deltas is a volcanic biome situated in the Nether.

title: Permission level
summary:
Permission level is used to describe permissions of a player or a command executor.
For example, in Bedrock Edition, /setmaxplayers can't be executed in a command block, because this command requires executor to have permission of level 3, while command blocks have a permission level of only 1.

title: Footprint
summary: The Footprint was a joke item from Java Edition 20w14∞, found only in the missing dimension.

title: Zoglin
summary: Zoglins are undead hostile mobs created when a hoglin enters the Overworld or End. They attack all mobs (and armor stands) indiscriminately, with the exception of other zoglins and creepers.

title: Funky Portal
summary: The funky portal is a block introduced in Java Edition 20w14∞ that allows entry into randomly generated dimensions. It is a colored variant of the nether portal block with the color being determined by the destination dimension.

title: Swaggiest stairs ever
summary: The swaggiest stairs ever is a block introduced in Java Edition 20w14∞ which is the stair variant for the netherite block.

title: An Ant
summary: An ant is a block introduced in Java Edition 20w14∞ that moves around when placed on top of black or white concrete.

title: Box of Infinite Books
summary: The box of infinite books is a block introduced in Java Edition 20w14∞ that provides a written book containing random text when used. It uses the texture of oak planks on all but one face, on which it has its own bookshelf-like texture randomized based on its location.

title: A Very Fine Item
summary: A very fine item was a joke item from Java Edition 20w14∞, found only in the isolation dimension.

title: Warped Fungus on a Stick
summary: A warped fungus on a stick is an item that can be used to control saddled striders.

title: Strider
summary: Striders are passive mobs native to the Nether. They can walk/stride on lava and be saddled by the player. A warped fungus on a stick is needed to control a strider, similar to how a pig is controlled by a carrot on a stick.

title: Lodestone
summary: A lodestone is a block that can be used to alter compasses to point toward it. It can be used in all three dimensions.

title: Universally unique identifier
summary: UUIDs (Universally unique identifiers; Java Class) are 128 bit long numbers that are used by Minecraft to distinguish between separate instances.

title: Diamond Chicken
summary: Diamond chickens were a rare variant of chicken present in the April Fool's Java Edition 2.0 that lays Lapis Lazulis or Diamonds instead of eggs.

title: Glow Squid
summary: The glow squid is an aquatic passive mob found in dark underwater areas, typically in ocean depths, ravines and underground lakes. The glow squid is a variety of squid. It has an aqua luminescent texture. They were ported to vanilla Minecraft from Minecraft Earth.

title: Respawn Anchor
summary: The respawn anchor is a block that allows players to set their spawn point in the Nether.

title: Commands/resupply
summary:
Update the villagers' supply for economic trade. 
Syntax

resupply
Result
Always success. Update villagers' economic trade supply in all loaded chunks.

title: Armor materials
summary: Armor materials refer to the material that an armor item uses.

title: Tiers
summary: Tiers refer to the different levels and materials of tools and weapons.

title: Soul Speed
summary: Soul Speed is an enchantment that can be applied on boots and allows the player to walk more quickly on soul sand and soul soil.

title: Twisting Vines
summary: Twisting vines are climbable upward-growing vegetation blocks found in the Nether in warped forests.

title: Nether Gold Ore
summary: Nether gold ore is a variant of gold ore found only in the Nether.

title: Smarter Watch
summary: The Smarter Watch was a joke offhand item.

title: Ankle Monitor
summary: The Ankle monitor was a joke foot item.

title: Reality Vision
summary: The Reality vision was a joke helmet.

title: USB Charger Block
summary: The USB charger block was a block introduced in Java Edition 1.RV-Pre1. It provided a redstone output like that of a block of redstone.

title: Crafting descriptions
summary: In alpha builds of Pocket Edition, crafting interfaces held descriptions for the item to be crafted.

title: Bartering
summary: Bartering is an action the player can perform with piglins to obtain various items.

title: Bastion Remnant
summary: Bastion remnants are large, castle-like generated structures found in the Nether in all of the biomes except basalt deltas. They generate in four distinct variants, each with a unique structure and set of loot. Piglins and piglin brutes spawn in these structures on generation, and hoglins may also spawn on generation in the bridge and hoglin stables variants. Bastion remnants are the only place to find gilded blackstone, the Pigstep music disc, the snout banner pattern, and the magma cube monster spawner.

title: Vegetation
summary: Vegetations are features composed of plants and fungi including grass, ferns, flowers, and mushrooms.

title: Roots
summary: Roots are a non-solid "plant" block that come in two variants, crimson roots and warped roots, which generate naturally on warped or crimson nylium and soul soil in their respective biomes. They resemble a colony of tall, thin mushrooms.

title: Nether Sprouts
summary: Nether sprouts are a non-solid fungi block that generate in warped forests.

title: Weeping Vines
summary: Weeping vines are climbable downwards-growing vegetation blocks found in the Nether in crimson forests.

title: Huge fungus
summary: A huge fungus is a large "tree" structure that generates in the Nether. There are two types of huge fungi: the huge crimson fungus and the huge warped fungus.

title: Crimson Forest
summary: The crimson forest is a forested biome in the Nether.

title: Fungus
summary: A fungus is a mushroom-like block that generates in the Nether. There are two types of fungi: crimson and warped.

title: Warped Forest
summary: The warped forest is a biome found in the Nether. It is a relatively safe biome because no hostile mobs spawn there naturally.

title: Nether Fossil
summary: Nether fossils are fossils that generate in soul sand valleys.

title: Nylium
summary: Nylium is a variant of netherrack that generates in the Nether. It has two variants: warped nylium and crimson nylium which both spawn in different biomes.

title: Netherite Scrap
summary: Netherite scrap is a material smelted from ancient debris, which is found in the Nether. It is used solely for crafting netherite ingots. Like all netherite-related items, it is not flammable.

title: Shroomlight
summary: Shroomlights are light-emitting blocks that generate in huge fungi.

title: Ancient Debris
summary: Ancient debris is a rare ore found in the Nether, and is the main source of netherite scraps. Its high blast resistance makes it immune to normal explosions. In item form, it floats on lava and cannot be burned by any form of fire.

title: Commands/locatebiome
summary: Displays the coordinates for the closest biome of a given biome ID or a biome tag in the chat for the player who executed the command.

title: Block of Netherite
summary: A block of netherite is a precious metal block made from nine netherite ingots. Unlike most items, it is resistant to fire and lava.

title: Netherite Ingot
summary: Netherite ingots are items obtained from crafting netherite scraps and gold ingots together, as well as loot from bastion remnant loot chests.  Unlike other items, they are immune to fire and lava damage. They are primarily used to upgrade diamond gear and craft lodestones.

title: Sofia Dankis
summary: Sofia Dankis is a writer for Minecraft.net. She is swedish. Depending to the website of Minecraft, she's a staff member. Her minecraft IGN is SofiaDankis

title: How to play
summary: In Bedrock Edition, How to Play is a built-in guide designed to help new and old players to Minecraft.

title: Per Landin
summary: Per Landin is a creative communications assistant and minecraft.net editor at Mojang Studios and writes Minecraft.net blog posts.

title: Com.mojang
summary: com.mojang is the folder used internally by Minecraft Bedrock Edition. It contains worlds, JSON data, and other files necessary for the game to run.

title: Animation placeholder texture
summary: Animated blocks and fluids had backup placeholder textures in terrain.png, overwritten in memory with the generated animations, which would be used if the animated texture could not be loaded.

title: Basalt
summary:
Basalt is an igneous rock found in the Nether.
 Polished basalt is the polished version of basalt and can be found as part of ancient cities.
 Smooth basalt is an ornamental rock smelted from basalt or found as part of amethyst geodes and ancient cities.

title: Soul Soil
summary: Soul soil is a block found abundantly in soul sand valleys. Unlike soul sand it does not slow down players or mobs that walk on it.

title: Whitelist.json
summary: whitelist.json is a server configuration file that stores the usernames of players who have been whitelisted on a server.

title: Chris Nordgren
summary: Chris Nordgren is a virtual effects artist and 3D artist at Mojang Studios, working on Minecraft Dungeons. He had also developed and published Everhood alongside Jordi Roca, as Foreign Gnomes.

title: Mårten Helander
summary: Mårten Helander is a game developer at Mojang Studios, working on Minecraft Dungeons.

title: Daniel Bjorkeförs
summary: Daniel Björkefors is an art director at Mojang Studios, working on Minecraft Dungeons.

title: Adrian Toncean
summary: Adrian Toncean is a game developer at Mojang Studios, working on Minecraft Dungeons.

title: David Nisshagen
summary: David Nisshagen is an Executive Producer at Mojang Studios, working on Minecraft Dungeons.

title: Annica Strand
summary: Annica Strand is a game developer at Mojang Studios, working on Minecraft Dungeons.

title: Buzzy Bees
summary: Buzzy Bees was a major update, mainly focused on bees and the items relating to them, as well as also fixing bugs from previous versions.

title: Disk
summary: A disk is a feature consisting of a naturally generated roughly circular deposit of a soil-like block under or next to bodies of water.

title: Ore (feature)
summary: An ore is a feature consisting of a natural deposit of ores or other blocks in the ground.

title: Basalt pillar
summary: Basalt pillars are tall features made up of basalt block.

title: Spawn event
summary: A spawn event, also known as a mob event, is a way to spawn entities under certain event conditions. Spawn events are used in commands such as /summon and /event.

title: Drinks
summary: Drinks are a narrow class of consumable items that can be ingested by the player in an extremely similar manner to food.

title: Cleaving
summary: Cleaving is an enchantment applied to an axe that increases the axe's damage and shield disabling.

title: Hoglin
summary: A hoglin is a breedable hostile mob found in the Nether, and a source of porkchops and leather. Hoglins are repelled by warped fungi, but only if it is placed in the world.

title: Commands/spectate
summary: Causes a player in Spectator mode to spectate another entity.

title: Honeycomb Block
summary: Honeycomb blocks are decorative blocks crafted from honeycombs.

title: Minecraft Live 2020
summary: Minecraft Live 2020 was a live event held on October 3, 2020, from 16:00 UTC. Originally, it was planned that Minecraft Festival, a real-world event similar to the original MINECON events, would occur; however, because of the COVID-19 pandemic, Minecraft Festival was pushed back to 2022. The live event streamed on YouTube, Twitch, Facebook, and Minecraft.net. Mojang announced the Caves & Cliffs update during the event.

title: Minecraft Festival
summary: Minecraft Festival is an in-person Minecraft convention similar to MINECON that is planned to be held in Orlando, Florida, on a yet to be announced date. It was originally set to be held from September 25–27, 2020, but was postponed three times due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The online portion of the event is called Minecraft Live! [sic]

title: Target
summary: A target is a block that provides a temporary redstone charge when hit by a projectile. Unlike all other redstone-conductive blocks it also redirects adjacent redstone dust towards it.

title: Soul Sand Valley
summary: A soul sand valley is a dry biome located in the Nether. It is formed of large caverns with nether fossils and different blocks, mainly including soul sand and soul soil.

title: Nether Update
summary: The Nether Update is a major update themed around revamping the Nether.

title: Honey Block
summary: Honey blocks are storage blocks equivalent to four honey bottles. Honey blocks are sticky and can be used in conjunction with pistons to move blocks and adhered entities.

title: Goat
summary: A goat is a neutral mob found in certain mountainous biomes. Goats can jump especially high and ram mobs. They are a source of goat horns and milk.

title: Mob Vote
summary:
Mob Vote may refer to:

The 2017 Mob Vote
The 2018 China Edition Mob Vote
The 2020 Mob Vote
The 2021 Mob Vote
The 2022 Mob Vote

title: Anvil mechanics/Repairable items
summary: Anything not listed below does not have a unit repair item, and can be repaired only by consuming another instance of itself.

title: Frog
summary: A frog is a passive mob found in swamps. Frogs eat small slimes and magma cubes. A frog can produce one of three kinds of Froglights from eating magma cubes, depending on the type of frog.

title: Predicate
summary: Predicates are JSON structures found in multiple different locations within data packs.

title: Obfuscation map
summary: Obfuscation maps are ProGuard mappings from old (original) names to new (obfuscated) names for classes and class members that have been renamed. They have been exported in the client.json for every snapshot and release available in the Launcher since 19w36a, and the client.json for 1.14.4 has been updated slightly after 19w36a's release to include obfuscation maps as well.

title: Command storage format
summary: The command_storage_<namespace>.dat files are GZip'd NBT files located in the data folder in a savegame. They store information about the /data command storage in the world. Each namespace in the storage has its own data file.

title: Lying
summary: Lying is a body position adopted by the player and some other mobs under certain circumstances.

title: Double Eleven
summary:
Double Eleven is a British game development studio based in Middlesbrough, England.
The studio is responsible for developing Minecraft Dungeons alongside Mojang Studios and Xbox Game Studios, particularly with multiplayer, DLC content and the console versions.

title: RenderDragon
summary: RenderDragon is a rendering engine used in Bedrock Edition that runs on DirectX and OpenGL ES.

title: Ore vein
summary: An ore vein is a rare underground terrain feature that provides massive amounts of ore.

title: Light Block
summary: Light blocks (in Bedrock Edition) or lights (in Java Edition) are invisible blocks, primarily intended for map makers, that can produce any light level from 0 to 15. The light block is also the only light-emitting block capable of producing light level 8.

title: Beehive
summary: Bee nests and beehives are blocks that house bees, with bee nests being natural and beehives crafted. They fill with honey as bees pollinate flowers and return to their homes and, when full, can either be sheared for honeycombs or honey bottles extracted using glass bottles.

title: Honeycomb
summary: Honeycombs are items obtained from bee nests and beehives.

title: Honey Bottle
summary: A honey bottle is a consumable drink item obtainable by using a glass bottle on a full beehive.  Honey bottles remove poison when drunk and can be used to craft honey blocks and sugar.

title: Bee
summary: Bees are flying neutral mobs that live in bee nests and beehives. Bees pollinate flowers and, when they do, add honey to their home when they return to it. When full, bee nests or beehives can be harvested with shears for honeycombs or glass bottles for honey bottles. If provoked by being attacked or breaking or harvesting their hive or nest without the correct precautions, bees suicidally attack in a swarm.

title: Feedback site
summary:
The Minecraft Feedback Site is the official website location for players to share their feedback for Minecraft. Similar to the bug tracker, the site is moderated by the community team. The feedback site is located here, and currently has 27 categories in which to post feedback in:

Caves & Cliffs
Java Edition Snapshots
Biomes and Dimensions
Community and Live Events
Graphics
Minecraft Earth
Parity
Scripting and Mods
User Interface, Input Methods and Menu Options
Java Combat Snapshot
Add-ons
Blocks, Tools, and Items
Education Related
Launcher
Minecraft (Franchise)
Realms and Dedicated Servers
Sounds
Villagers, NPCs, Humanoids
Minecraft: Dungeons
Bedrock Betas
Commands
Gameplay
Marketplace/Store
Mobs, Animals and non-Humanoids
Redstone
Structures
Website

title: Version manifest.json
summary: version_manifest.json and its variant version_manifest_v2.json are files containing a list of Java Edition versions from piston-meta.mojang.com.

title: Version.json
summary: version.json is embedded within client.jar in .minecraft/versions/<version> or server.jar since 18w47b. It offers some basic information about the version's attributes.

title: Advancement/JSON format
summary: Custom advancements in data packs of a Minecraft world store the advancement data for that world as separate JSON files.

title: Client.json
summary: client.json is the file that accompanies client.jar in .minecraft/versions/<version> and lists the version's attributes. When using the latest version of the Minecraft launcher, it is named <game version>.json. The JSON file for specific versions is located in the version_manifest.json file.

title: Argument types
summary: This page contains a list of all command argument types.

title: 2×2 grid
summary: The 2×2 crafting grid is used for basic crafting using a subset of the possible crafting recipes.

title: Monster infighting
summary: Monster infighting is a mechanic in Minecraft in which certain mobs retaliate against other mobs.

title: Minecraft Dungeons
summary: Minecraft Dungeons is an action-adventure role-playing video game developed by Mojang Studios, Xbox Game Studios and Double Eleven.

title: Version formats
summary: Each edition and development phases of Minecraft uses a different versioning system.

title: Protocol version
summary: A protocol version number (PVN) is an integer used to check for incompatibilities between the player's client and the server they are trying to connect to.

title: Data version
summary: A data version, also known as a world version, is a positive integer used in a world saved data to denote a specific version, and determines whether the player should be warned about opening that world due to client version incompatibilities.

title: Wurm Online
summary: Wurm Online is a multiplayer online role-playing game, which Minecraft creator Markus Persson (Notch) started developing with his friend Rolf Jansson in 2002. Although Minecraft, which came out seven years later, bears little graphical similarity to Wurm Online, Minecraft does share many conceptual similarities, making Wurm Online one of Minecraft's many precursors and inspirations.

title: Sitting
summary: Sitting is a game mechanic used by the player and some mobs under specific circumstances.

title: Trading/Before Village & Pillage
summary: In Village & Pillage, trading was significantly revamped. This page is about villager_v1 trading in Bedrock Edition, or before Java Edition 1.14 was released.

title: Minecraft Earth
summary: Minecraft Earth was a free-to-play augmented reality (AR) spin-off mobile game developed by Mojang Studios and published by Xbox Game Studios for iOS, iPadOS, and Android.
