The game was about building structures and collecting materials by traveling to real-life locations. Minecraft Earth was released in closed beta on July 16, 2019, and gradually expanded its available countries over the rest of 2019, being released worldwide on December 11, 2019. The game received its final update, 0.33.0, on January 5, 2021, and was discontinued on June 30, 2021, due to restrictions on outdoor activities as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic. The next day, all players that had a remaining paid balance of Rubies were given Minecoins, and players who purchased anything in the game received a copy of Bedrock Edition in return.

title: Henrik Kniberg
summary: Henrik Kniberg is a coach and former game developer at Mojang Studios who works on Minecraft: Java Edition.

title: Snowlogging
summary: Snowlogging is a mechanic in Bedrock Edition that allows layers of snow to occupy the same block space as certain types of vegetation.

title: Classic remake data values
summary: These values apply to blocks placed in the world in the remake of Classic 0.0.23a_01. IDs in light blue cannot be legitimately obtained in the player's inventory in the game; they can only be obtained by inventory editors.

title: Missing versions
summary:
The following pages list missing versions:

Missing Java Edition versions
Missing launcher versions

title: Aubrey Norris
summary: Aubrey Jude Norris is the former head community manager for Minecraft at Mojang Studios. She worked at the Redmond office in the United States.

title: Minecraft (Dark Horse Comics)
summary: Minecraft is a graphic novel series based on the video game of the same name, published by Dark Horse Comics in partnership with Mojang Studios.

title: Brigadier
summary: Brigadier is a command parser and dispatcher, designed and developed for Java Edition, mainly maintained by Dinnerbone. It is the first library used by Java Edition that Mojang has released under an open-source license.

title: Seed Templates
summary: The seed templates (or seed picker prior to Bedrock Edition 1.19.0) is an interface in Bedrock Edition that allows the player to choose from a number of preset seeds for generating worlds with specific interesting features near the spawn point.

title: Crawling
summary: Crawling is a mechanic that prevents the player from suffocating when inside small gaps. Crawling covers a pose that occurs when the player is in an area less than 1.5 blocks high.

title: Molang
summary:
Molang is a simple expression-based language designed for fast, data-driven calculation of values at run-time, and with a direct connection to in-game values and systems. It is used in Bedrock Edition's Add-on system with its purpose being enabling low-level systems like animation to support flexible data-driven behavior for both internal and external creators, while staying highly performant. 
Mojang provides official documentation Molang Documentation which goes into details of how the language works and where it's used.

title: Resource location
summary: Resource locations (also known as namespaced IDs, namespaced identifiers, resource identifiers, or namespaced strings) are a way to declare and specify game objects in Minecraft, which can identify built-in and user-defined objects without potential ambiguity or conflicts.

title: Official pages
summary: This page formerly listed articles that were maintained by Mojang as official documentation pages.

title: 3D
summary: 3D was a joke item from Java Edition 3D Shareware v1.34. Eating it shows a picture of the developer cast.

title: Key
summary:
Keys were a joke item from Java Edition 3D Shareware v1.34.
There are three different keys: red, yellow, and blue.

title: Instant mining
summary: Instant mining is a game mechanic in which 1 block can be broken per game tick without the delay of 3⁄10 of a second (6 ticks). Below are listed the tool tier and the Efficiency and Haste levels necessary to instant-mine a block.

title: Loading tips
summary: Loading tips are shown on the world loading screen in Bedrock Edition.

title: Procedural animated texture generation/Clocks
summary: To generate its appearances, the clock combined 2 textures, one being the actual clock, and the other being the dial.

title: Commands/mobevent
summary: Controls or queries what mob events are allowed to run.

title: Experimental Gameplay
summary: Experimental Gameplay (also known in-game as Experiments) is a game option exclusive to Bedrock Edition. When enabled, it allows players to test some unfinished or work-in-progress features that would eventually be released in future updates.

title: Samuel Åberg
summary: Samuel Åberg is a Mojang Studios employee currently working as the lead sound designer of Minecraft.

title: Wither (effect)
summary: Wither is a status effect that inflicts damage over time.

title: Resistance
summary: Resistance is a status effect that reduces incoming damage.

title: Hero of the Village
summary: Hero of the Village is a status effect granted to the player upon defeating a raid.

title: Seasonal Forest
summary: Seasonal forests were a lush biome, which existed in the game prior to the Adventure Update. They were a lower density version of the forest biome only capable of spawning oak trees. They usually consisted of low plains and could be mountainous at higher rainfalls.

title: Shrubland
summary: Shrublands were a biome, that was introduced in the Halloween Update, which existed in the game prior to the Adventure Update. they were usually quite flat due to height variation decreasing at lower rainfalls. In the Beta 1.8 Adventure Update they were removed from the game.

title: Rain Forest
summary: Rain forests were a lush biome that was introduced in the Halloween Update, which existed in the game prior to the first part of the Adventure Update. They can be viewed as a forerunner to the jungle biome seen in later versions of Minecraft, specifically versions after Java Edition 1.2.1. Due to their denser-than-average vegetation, there is a higher concentration of oak and birch trees, and Large oak trees are generated more often. They usually consist of low, flat plains and high cliffs and hills but can be very mountainous.

title: Guides
summary:
This page links to version specific non-technical guides of Minecraft.

Java Edition guides - for guides about Java Edition versions
Bedrock Edition guides - for guides about the Bedrock Edition versions

title: Wandering Trader
summary: The wandering trader is a passive mob that randomly spawns near the player. It can trade, making natural items more available, less dangerous to obtain, and in some cases, renewable.

title: Donkey
summary: Donkeys are variants of horses that, when tamed, can be ridden and equipped with chests.

title: Mule
summary: Mules are infertile offspring of horses and donkeys that, when tamed, can be ridden and equipped with chests.

title: Raid captain
summary: A raid captain is the occurrence of an illager spawning with an Ominous Banner (in Java Edition) / Illager Banner (in Bedrock Edition) on top of its head, usually a pillager or vindicator, or rarely in Java Edition an evoker.

title: Composter
summary: A composter is a block that converts some biological material into bone meal. It also serves as a farmer villager's job site block.

title: New Nintendo 3DS Edition 1.9.19
summary: 1.9.19 is the final update for the New Nintendo 3DS Edition, released on January 15/16, 2019, which added features of the Discovery Update.

title: Axolotl
summary: An axolotl is a passive aquatic mob endemic to the lush caves biome that hunts most other aquatic mobs.

title: Raids.dat format
summary: The raids.dat file located in the data folder of every Minecraft level is used to store information about the raids in the level.

title: Commands/teammsg
summary: Sends message to all players in the team of the entity who runs the command.

title: Max Herngren
summary: Max Herngren was a game developer at Mojang Studios, who worked on Minecraft Dungeons. On April 24, 2021, Max announced over Twitter that he left Mojang Studios.

title: Jifeng Zhang
summary: Jifeng Zhang is a former DevOps engineer at Mojang Studios.

title: ModJam
summary: ModJam is a form of community event where participants create fan-made content within a set period of time. These events typically focus on Java Edition mods, but maps, textures, and mod packs have all been included to various degrees. It is widely accepted that Searge is the originator of this term within the Minecraft community.

title: Biome/Before TU5
summary: In Xbox 360 Edition TU5, biomes received a major overhaul, removing and changing many biomes.

title: Ice Desert
summary: Ice deserts were cold, unused biomes, which existed prior to the Adventure Update.

title: Glowstone blob
summary: Glowstone blobs (also known as the glowstone clusters) generate on the underside of terrain blocks in the Nether.

title: Fatal Poison
summary: Fatal Poison inflicts damage to entities over time, and can kill both undead and non-undead mobs, similar to Wither. The effect is actually called "Poison," but its ID distinguishes it from the other Poison effect, which cannot kill.

title: Raid
summary: A raid is an in-game event in which waves of various mobs, mainly illagers, spawn and attack a village. It is triggered when a player with the Bad Omen status effect enters a village.

title: Pillager Outpost
summary: A pillager outpost is an assortment of structures inhabited by pillagers.

title: Bad Omen
summary: Bad Omen is a status effect that causes a raid to appear when an afflicted player enters a village. This does not apply to any other mob with the effect if the mob is in a village.

title: New Nintendo 3DS Edition 1.8.13
summary: 1.8.13 was an update for the New Nintendo 3DS Edition released on November 20/21, 2018, which added new downloadable content and fixed bugs.

title: Library
summary: The Library is a feature to simplify the process of finding and importing educational content directly in the game. It is available exclusively for teachers and students that uses Minecraft Education. It contains a list of the most popular worlds to import and use.

title: Commands/remove
summary: Has the same function as /kill.

title: Jigsaw Block
summary: Jigsaw blocks are technical blocks used in the generation of some structures.

title: Commands/drop
summary: Lets your agent drop specified Inventory Slot Numbered Items in the specified quantity in the specified direction.

title: Patrol
summary: A patrol‌ or pillager patrol‌ is a rare, naturally-spawning group of pillagers.

title: Grindstone
summary: A grindstone is a block that repairs items and tools as well as removing enchantments from them, except for curses. It also serves as a weaponsmith's job site block.

title: Bell
summary: A bell is a transparent, animated block entity that produces a sound when used. Unlike most utility blocks, bells cannot be crafted.

title: Smithing Table
summary: A smithing table is a utility block used to upgrade diamond gear into netherite gear, a process that keeps all enchantments. It also serves as a toolsmith's job site block.

title: Barrel
summary: A barrel is a solid block used to store items. Unlike a chest it cannot connect to other barrels and blocks placed above it do not prevent it from opening. It also serves as a fisherman's job site block.

title: Blast Furnace
summary: A blast furnace is a block that smelts ores, raw metals and metal armor and tools twice as quickly as a furnace but cannot smelt anything else. It also serves as an armorer's job site block.

title: Cartography Table
summary: A cartography table is a utility block used for cloning, zooming out and locking maps. It also serves as a cartogropher's job site block.

title: Smoker
summary: A smoker is a block that smelts food twice as quickly as a furnace but cannot smelt anything else. It also serves as a butcher's job site block.

title: Fletching Table
summary: A fletching table is a fletcher's job site block that can generate naturally in villages. The fletching table is used to turn an unemployed villager into a Fletcher.

title: Commands/schedule
summary: In Java Edition, delays the execution of a function.

title: Banner Pattern
summary:
Banner patterns are items used to customize banners inside looms.
There are six patterns in Java Edition and eight in Bedrock Edition.

title: Loom
summary: A loom is used to apply patterns to banners. It also serves as a shepherd's job site block.

title: Suspicious Stew
summary: Suspicious stew is a food item that can give the player a status effect that depends on the flower used to craft it.

title: Piercing
summary: Piercing is an enchantment applied to a crossbow that causes arrows to pierce through entities.

title: Quick Charge
summary: Quick Charge is an enchantment for quickly reloading a crossbow.

title: Multishot
summary: Multishot is an enchantment for crossbows that allow them to shoot three arrows or firework rockets at the cost of one.

title: New Nintendo 3DS Edition 0.1.0
summary: 0.1.0 was the first release for the New Nintendo 3DS Edition which came out on September 13/14, 2017.

title: Brown Dye
summary: Brown dye is a primary color dye derived from cocoa beans.

title: White Dye
summary: White dye is a primary color dye similar to bone meal.

title: Campfire
summary: A campfire is a block that can be used to cook food, pacify bees, act as a spread-proof light source, smoke signal or damaging trap block.

title: Sweet Berries
summary:
Sweet berries are a food item that are collected from sweet berry bushes.
Sweet berry bushes are thorny plants used to grow sweet berries.

title: Scaffolding
summary: Scaffolding is a climbable semi-solid block that can be stood on without falling as well as be placed and broken easily.

title: Fox
summary: A fox is a tameable passive mob that spawns in taigas, old growth taigas, snowy taigas and mountain groves. They are able to carry a single item in their mouth, but prefer food over other items.

title: Pillager
summary: Pillagers are hostile mobs armed with crossbows found in wandering patrols or as participants in raids. They attack by firing arrows at the player.

title: Crossbow
summary: A crossbow is a ranged weapon similar to a bow that uses arrows or fireworks as ammunition.

title: Ravager
summary: Ravagers are large hostile mobs that spawn in raids and attack players, villagers (excluding baby villagers), wandering traders, and iron golems. They attack by charging at players to ram them, but can also roar if they were stopped by a shield.

title: Panda
summary: A panda is a rare neutral mob that resides in jungles. Certain aspects of a panda's behavior and appearance vary depending on its personality.

title: Village & Pillage
summary: Village & Pillage was a major update themed around revamping villages that was released for versions of Minecraft in 2019, with the exception of the Xbox 360 Edition, Xbox One Edition, PlayStation 3 Edition, PlayStation Vita Edition, Wii U Edition, and New Nintendo 3DS Edition.

title: New Nintendo 3DS Edition 1.7.10
summary: 1.7.10 was an update for the New Nintendo 3DS Edition released on September 19/20, 2018, which added the features of the Ender Update, which included the End along with all End-related content (excluding shulker boxes). This is the first version to be released outside of North America and Japan.

title: Biome/IDs before 1.13
summary: Each type of biome has its own biome id, shown in the following table. Main biomes have a numeric ID from 0 to 127, while biome variations normally have a numeric ID of 128 + <original biome number>. Extreme Hills Edge and Frozen Ocean biomes did not generate anymore.

title: Duncan Geere
summary: Duncan Geere is a writer, editor and data journalist who wrote parts of the minecraft.net "Block of the Week" series, from the 21st episode to the last. This was continued in 2020 with scaffolding, honey, target, and basalt. He also currently writes the "Taking Inventory" and "Around The Block" series in minecraft.net. In 2010, Duncan wrote an article for Wired UK about his first experience playing Minecraft.

title: Commands/forceload
summary: Force chunks to load constantly or not, forceload add, forceload query and forceload remove are three separated commands.

title: Josh Letellier
summary: Josh 'rockenroll4life' Letellier is a former member of the Minecraft: Java Edition development team at Mojang Studios from July 16, 2018 to April 10, 2019.

title: Petr Mrázek
summary: Petr 'peterix' Mrázek is a member of the Minecraft: Java Edition development team at Mojang Studios, since June 2018. He was announced on May 14, 2018. He was hired to work on the Minecraft Launcher, especially on Linux. He is known for creating MultiMC, which he continues to develop.

title: New Nintendo 3DS Edition 1.6.11
summary: 1.6.11 was an update for the New Nintendo 3DS Edition released on July 24/25, 2018, which added new DLC packs to the store.

title: Pufferfish (item)
summary: A pufferfish is a poisonous food item that is used to brew Water Breathing potions.

title: Tropical Fish (item)
summary: Tropical fish is a food item that cannot be cooked.

title: Minecraft Mini-Series
summary:
The Minecraft Mini-Series is a Canadian-American action/adventure animated web series based on Mojang Studios's Minecraft. The series is produced by Mojang Studios and Xbox Game Studios in collaboration with Atomic Cartoons and Mattel Creations, with Christopher Keenan serving as executive producer, and premiered on October 26, 2017, on the Mattel Action YouTube channel, with the final episode being released on May 10, 2018. 
It was met with mixed reviews.

title: Waterlogging
summary: Waterlogging is the mechanic that allows non-cube blocks (that is, blocks that do not completely fill their block volume, such as doors, ladders, and plants) to be filled with a water source block.

title: Missing launcher versions
summary: The following is a list of versions that are not included in the Java Edition launcher. If a version is labeled as edited, it means that the META-INF files in the jar are dated differently from the release date. This is because when these versions were added (in 2013), the META-INF had to be renewed. Versions labeled as edited are currently in the launcher; if a version is listed but not labeled as edited, it is not available in the launcher.

title: Ice spike
summary: Ice spikes are common features made of ice. Ice spikes only generate in Ice Spikes biomes.

title: Nizzotch
summary: Nizzotch is a YouTube channel that was used by Markus Persson (Notch) to share videos of Minecraft's development.

title: The End (biome)
summary: The End is a biome used to generate the End dimension. There are five variants in the biome family.‌

title: Rarity
summary: Rarity is a statistic applied to items and blocks to signify their value and ease in obtaining.

title: Snooper
summary: Snooper is a feature Mojang is using to collect data on users, either by the client or by the server. This feature was removed in 1.13 globally because of the European Union's General Data Protection Regulations. However, it was re-added as an always-on telemetry tool in Java Edition 1.18 snapshot 21w38a to "improve players' experience". It is no longer possible to disable the Snooper without client modifications.

title: Bartosz Bok
summary: Bartosz Bok is a game developer at Mojang Studios who works on Minecraft, and has done work on Java Edition. He joined the company in November 2017. He earned his Master's degree in Computer Science at Wrocław University of Science and Technology and had previously worked as a senior developer at MicroscopeIT, and before that, as a software developer at Nokia.

title: Pause menu
summary: The pause menu is one of Minecraft's multiple menu screens.

title: New Nintendo 3DS Edition 1.5.25
summary: 1.5.25 was an update for the New Nintendo 3DS Edition released on June 5/6, 2018, which added coarse dirt, stained glass, and a store for DLC packs.

title: New Nintendo 3DS Edition 1.1.06
summary: 1.1.06 was an update for the New Nintendo 3DS Edition released on November 8/9, 2017, which improved performance and fixed bugs.

title: New Nintendo 3DS Edition 1.2.12
summary: 1.2.12 was an update for the New Nintendo 3DS Edition released on December 22, 2017, which added achievements.

title: New Nintendo 3DS Edition 1.3.12
summary: 1.3.12 was an update for the New Nintendo 3DS Edition which added the features of the Boss Update. This update was released on January 30/31, 2018, and added ocean monuments.

title: New Nintendo 3DS Edition 1.4.23
summary: 1.4.23 was an update for the New Nintendo 3DS Edition released on March 21–22, 2018, which added multiplayer and fixed bugs.

title: Commands/daylock
summary: Locks and unlocks eternal daytime.

title: Commands/mixer
summary: Controls Mixer interactivity.

title: Cory Scheviak
summary: Cory 'Cojomax99' Scheviak is a member of the Minecraft: Java Edition and Minecraft Dungeons development teams at Mojang Studios. He was announced on May 11, 2018. Most of what he does with the Mojang team is fixing bugs. He is currently actively developing the Tropicraft and Camera Obscura Minecraft mods. He started playing Minecraft in October 2010, and began developing mods in 2011.

title: Dolphin's Grace
summary: Dolphin's Grace is a status effect that increases the player's swimming speed when a dolphin is nearby.

title: Medicine
summary: A medicine is a type of potion that cures the specified effect instead of applying it.

title: Sparkler
summary:
A sparkler is a chemistry-related item that emits particles when lit.
Sparklers are available in orange, blue, red, purple, and green colors.

title: Code builder
summary: The code builder is a UI that can be accessed via pressing the C key on PC or the third icon resembling the agent at the top-middle area on mobile.

title: Classroom Mode
summary: Classroom Mode for Minecraft is a companion application for Minecraft: Education Edition. Classroom Mode can be used to access a range of features specially designed to interact with students while hosting a multiplayer game by managing settings from a central user interface.

title: Buffet
summary: Buffet is a world type in which the entire Overworld consists of one biome (Single Biome). It is simple to customize, albeit very limited.

title: Chemistry Update
summary: The Chemistry Update is the name for Minecraft: Education Edition version 1.0.27, an update that was released on February 22, 2018.

title: Raw JSON text format
summary: Raw JSON text is the format Minecraft uses to send and display rich text to players. It can also be sent by players themselves using commands and data packs. Raw JSON text is written in JSON, a human-readable data format.

title: Ice Bomb
summary: The ice bomb is an item that is used to freeze water into ice.

title: Balloon
summary: Balloons are entities that float upward when placed.

title: Glow Stick
summary: Glow sticks are chemistry-related items, which can be lit up in the player's hand for a limited time.

title: Hardened Glass Pane
summary: A hardened glass pane is a type of block obtained by crafting with glass panes and several compounds.

title: Conduit Power
summary: Conduit Power is an area-of-effect status effect given by conduits that grants bonuses comparable to a combination of Water Breathing, Night Vision (only underwater), and Haste (only underwater).

title: Code Connection
summary: Code Connection for Minecraft is an extension that allows educators and students to explore, create, and play in an immersive Minecraft world – all by writing code.

title: Bubble Column
summary: A bubble column is a non-solid block generated by placing magma blocks or soul sand in water (source). Bubble columns push or pull entities and items in certain directions.

title: Hardened Glass
summary: Hardened glass is a type of glass that has been chemically strengthened. It is available in clear and colored variants, similarly to normal glass.

title: Bleach
summary: Bleach is an item used to dye things white. It is also known as a compound, as it is made using a lab table.

title: Lab Table
summary: The lab table is a block used in chemistry to design one's own experiments by combining substances and observing the results.

title: Material Reducer
summary: The material reducer is a block used in chemistry to learn about the natural world, by reducing Minecraft blocks to their component elements.

title: Compound Creator
summary: A compound creator is a block used in chemistry. It allows over thirty compounds to be created by combining elements. This includes certain items which are available in the game normally.

title: Element Constructor
summary: The element constructor is a block used in chemistry. It allows the construction of elements by adjusting the number of protons, electrons and neutrons.

title: Texture Update
summary: The Texture Update is an update released in Java Edition 1.14, Bedrock Edition 1.10.0, and PlayStation 4 Edition 1.90 (with further amendments in Bedrock Edition 1.17.10, as well as minor revisions in subsequent major updates for textures which were left behind).

title: Underwater Torch
summary: An underwater torch is a non-solid block that emits light underwater.

title: Super Fertilizer
summary: Super fertilizer is a powerful form of bone meal that is created using ammonia and phosphorus.

title: Compound
summary: Compounds are a type of item used in chemistry, which are created from combinations of various elements.

title: Heat Block
summary: Heat block is a block that can melt snow and ice just like a torch except it does not give off light.

title: Underwater TNT
summary: Underwater TNT is a block that can be used by the player to initiate a controlled explosion underwater.

title: Slow Falling
summary: Slow Falling is a status effect that causes the affected mob to fall slower and take no fall damage, but does not prevent ender pearl damage.

title: Conduit
summary: A conduit is a beacon-like block that provides Conduit Power and attacks hostile mobs underwater.

title: Sea Pickle
summary: A sea pickle is a small block that emits light underwater, and is typically found in colonies of up to four sea pickles.

title: Phantom Membrane
summary: Phantom membranes are obtained from killing phantoms.

title: Blue Ice
summary: Blue ice is a solid block similar to packed ice and ice, but much more slippery.

title: Swimming
summary: Swimming is a form of transportation that allows the player to move in water.

title: Shipwreck/Structure
summary: Shipwrecks are naturally-generated structures that generate underwater. They can generate right-side-up, sideways, or upside-down. Although various woods are used in the blueprints, the shipwrecks are composed of two different randomly selected wood types.

title: Drowned
summary: Drowned are common underwater zombie variants that spawn in oceans, rivers and dripstone caves, or when zombies drown. They usually attack through melee attacks, but may also come armed with tridents that they throw. They are the only source of tridents, and the only renewable source of copper.

title: Coral reef
summary: Coral reefs are features that generate in warm ocean biomes. They consist of multiple clusters of coral blocks, coral, and coral fans. These clusters come in a wide variety of shapes, sizes, and colors.

title: Buried treasure
summary: Buried treasure is a naturally generated structure that consists of a buried loot chest. The chest is buried primarily in beaches, and rarely in the ocean floor. Buried treasure is the only source of the heart of the sea, which can be used to craft a conduit. Buried treasure can be located using explorer maps.

title: Cod
summary: Cod are common passive aquatic mobs found in oceans.

title: Bucket of aquatic mob
summary: A bucket of aquatic mob is a form of a water bucket with an aquatic mob (a fish, axolotl, or tadpole) inside.

title: Channeling
summary: Channeling is a trident enchantment that produces lightning.

title: Riptide
summary: Riptide is an enchantment exclusive to tridents, which hurls the user in the direction the user is facing, but only when they are wet.

title: Impaling
summary: Impaling is an enchantment for a trident, causing the trident to deal extra damage on each hit against aquatic mobs‌, or extra damage to mobs in water‌.

title: Loyalty
summary: Loyalty is an enchantment applying to a trident, causing it to return to the owner once thrown. If the player dies while the trident is returning, the trident then drops in item form and is susceptible to despawning.

title: Dried Kelp
summary: Dried kelp is a food item that can be quickly eaten by the player. It can also be crafted into dried kelp blocks.

title: Scute
summary: Scutes are items that baby turtles drop when they grow into adults. They can be used to craft turtle shells which can be used to brew the potion of the Turtle Master.

title: Dried Kelp Block
summary: Dried kelp blocks are storage blocks equivalent to nine dried kelp that can also be used as fuel.

title: Seagrass
summary:
Seagrass is a non-solid plant block that generates in all oceans, except frozen oceans.
Tall seagrass is a two-block high variety of seagrass.

title: Petrified Oak Slab
summary: Petrified oak slabs are a unique type of slab available through commands or by upgrading from legacy versions. Unlike all other slabs, they are unobtainable through conventional Survival gameplay and the only way to obtain them is through commands.

title: Smooth Quartz Block
summary: A smooth quartz block is a mineral block used only for decoration. It is made by smelting blocks of quartz.

title: Commands/bossbar
summary: Creates and modifies boss bars.

title: Turtle Egg
summary: A turtle egg (in Java Edition) or sea turtle egg (in Bedrock Edition) is a block containing 1–4 eggs that each hatch into a baby turtle.

title: Minecraft Hour of Code
summary: The Minecraft Hour of Code is a campaign in which players can learn basic programming. It was created on November 16, 2015.

title: Iceberg
summary: An iceberg is a large feature composed of different types of ice.

title: Shipwreck
summary: A shipwreck is a sailing ship structure found in oceanic biomes.

title: Trident
summary: A trident is a weapon used in both melee and ranged combat and is a rare drop from drowned.

title: Turtle
summary: A turtle (in Java Edition), also known as a sea turtle (in Bedrock Edition), is a common passive mob found in beach biomes. They are the only source of scutes, which drop from baby turtles when they mature into adults.

title: Georgiy Gavrichev
summary: Georgii 'Fry' Gavrichev is a game developer at Mojang Studios who works on Minecraft: Java Edition.

title: China Edition
summary: Minecraft: China Edition is a localized edition of Java and Bedrock editions for mainland China, developed by Mojang Studios and NetEase. China Edition has 600 million players as of October 2022.

title: Minecraft Magazine
summary: Minecraft: Official Magazine are a series of magazines for Minecraft, which includes news, comics, build features, and exploration guides.

title: Debug Stick
summary: The debug stick is an item used to edit the block states of blocks. It is visually identical to a regular stick, but with a glint (as if enchanted).

title: Edition
summary: Minecraft has several editions, some of which are discontinued.

title: SkyBox Labs
summary: SkyBox Labs is a Canadian game development studio based out of Burnaby, British Columbia, Canada.

title: Phantom
summary: Phantoms are flying undead hostile mobs that spawn in the night sky when the player has not laid in a bed or died for three or more in-game days. They attack by diving at the player from the sky to bite them.

title: Dolphin
summary: Dolphins are neutral mobs  that live in non-frozen oceans, which grant a speed boost to players that swim near them.

title: Kelp
summary: Kelp is an underwater plant that generates in most oceans.

title: Update Aquatic
summary: The Update Aquatic is the name for a major update that was released for most versions of Minecraft in 2018, with the exception of the Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, and New Nintendo 3DS editions.

title: Commands/data
summary: The /data command allows the user to get, merge, modify, and remove NBT data of a block entity, entity, or Command NBT storage.

title: Commands/datapack
summary: Controls the loading/unloading of data packs.

title: Commands/tag
summary: Controls scoreboard tags on individual entities.

title: Commands/team
summary: Controls teams.

title: Data pack
summary: The data pack system provides a way for players to further customize their Minecraft experience. Data packs can be used to override or add new advancements, dimensions, functions, loot tables, predicates, recipes, structures, tags, world generation settings, and biomes without any code modification.

title: New Nintendo 3DS Edition exclusive features
summary: This is the list of features exclusive to the New Nintendo 3DS Edition.

title: Host privileges
summary: Host privileges are an option exclusive to the Legacy Console Edition, allowing the player to enable or disable the daylight cycle, weather cycle, keep inventory, mob spawning, and mob griefing. Enabling this option deactivates achievements or trophies permanently for this world.

title: Virtual reality
summary: Virtual reality (VR) is a mode natively exclusive to Bedrock Edition for Windows (formerly Windows 10 Edition) and PlayStation 4. It can be used with the Oculus Rift, Oculus Quest (via Oculus Link and Oculus Air Link), PlayStation VR, and all Windows Mixed Reality compatible headsets. It was previously available on Gear VR until October 2020, when it was discontinued along with some older devices.

title: Matthew Gartzke
summary: Matthew Gartzke, also known as Matt Gartzke, is a Community Manager at Mojang Studios.

title: Corey Clemans
summary: Corey Clemans is a former community coordinator for Latin America for Minecraft. On July 16, 2018, he announced his departure from the company.

title: New Nintendo 3DS Edition unused features
summary: This page is about features that were included in New Nintendo 3DS Edition, but are dummied out of the game. Many of these were originally part of Pocket Edition v0.15.4 alpha, from which the New Nintendo 3DS Edition is derived.

title: New Nintendo 3DS Edition version history
summary: The following is a chronological list of versions for Minecraft: New Nintendo 3DS Edition.

title: Other Ocean Interactive
summary: Other Ocean Interactive is an American independent game development studio based in Emeryville, California, with offices in Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island, Canada and St.

title: New Nintendo 3DS Edition
summary: Minecraft: New Nintendo 3DS Edition is the edition of Minecraft developed by Other Ocean Interactive and Mojang Studios for the New Nintendo 3DS/2DS systems, but is not compatible with the original Nintendo 3DS/2DS systems.

title: .minecraft/path
summary: Below is a table showing the default directory for .minecraft.

title: Moira Ingeltun
summary: Moira Ingeltun is a Video Producer at Mojang Studios.

title: Matthew Dryden
summary: Matthew Dryden is a QA Specialist for Java Edition at Minecraft. He was previously a Content Coordinator, and then Interim Content Lead.

title: Jay Wells
summary: Jay Wells is a Community Manager for Minecraft at Mojang Studios, and was formerly the Mojira Community Coordinator.

title: Commands/tickingarea
summary: Add, remove, or list ticking areas.

title: Ticking area
summary: A ticking area is a player-specified group of chunks that continues to be updated even when there is no player nearby. Because the chunks remain active, processes such as growth, decay, spawning, movement, and redstone operations aren't suspended in them when no players are present, provided at least one player remains somewhere in the dimension.

title: Jasper Boerstra
summary: Jasper Boerstra is a full time employee who is currently working for Mojang Studios as the Lead Artist for Minecraft. He was hired to change the great majority of the old textures in the game. Most of his changes to the game's textures took effect in the Texture Update, and he has since continued to create textures for new blocks, items, and entities.

title: Commands/solid
summary: Toggles between placing stone and placing bedrock.

title: Commands/unban
summary:
Pardons a banned player.
The Classic equivalent of /pardon.

Syntax
unban <name>

title: Commands/setspawn
summary:
Sets the current location as the default spawn location for new players.
The Classic equivalent of /setworldspawn.

Syntax
setspawn

title: Commands/home
summary: Teleports player to the world spawn.

title: Commands/position
summary: Toggles player coordinates to be displayed on the HUD.

title: Commands/achievement
summary: Gives or takes an achievement from a player.

title: Commands/broadcast
summary:
Broadcasts a message across the entire server.
Replaced by /say.

title: Commands/code
summary: Used to access code connection.

title: Commands/turn
summary: Rotates an Agent in a specified direction by 90 degrees.

title: Commands/transfer
summary: Transfers a specified quantity of items from one slot to another of your Agent's inventory.

title: Commands/tpagent
summary: Teleport the player to their Agent's position.

title: Commands/till
summary: Tills grass in the specified direction.

title: Commands/inspect
summary: Lets your agent return the name of the block in the specified direction.

title: Commands/move
summary: Moves an Agent in a specified direction.

title: Commands/inspectdata
summary: Lets your agent returns the data value of the block in the specified direction.

title: Commands/getitemspace
summary: Lets your agent return the number of spaces remaining in the specified slot, as in the number of items you could add before it would be full.

title: Commands/getitemcount
summary: Lets your agent return the number of items in the specified slot, as in how many the player could use before it would be empty.

title: Commands/dropall
summary: Makes an agent drop all its items from all slots onto the ground by one block in the specified direction.

title: Commands/getitemdetail
summary: Lets your agent return the name of the item in the specified slot.

title: Commands/destroy
summary: Makes your agent destroy a block or item in the specified direction.

title: Commands/detectredstone
summary: Lets your agent detect a redstone signal in the specified direction.

title: Commands/loot
summary: Drops the given loot table into the specified inventory or into the world.

title: Commands/detect
summary: Lets your agent detect if there is a collidable block in the specified direction.

title: Commands/createagent
summary: Creates an Agent at the current player's position.

title: Commands/attack
summary: Let the agent attack in the direction specified.

title: Commands/collect
summary: Lets your agent collect all items within a one block from Agent in three dimensions.

title: Commands/worldbuilder
summary: Toggles the ability to place and break blocks to enable or disable alternately.

title: Commands/setfixedinvslot
summary: Sets fixed inventory slot with a specific item.

title: Commands/setfixedinvslots
summary:
Sets the amount of fixed inventory slots.

Syntax
setfixedinvslots <fixedinvslotnum: int>
Arguments
fixedinvslotnum: int
Specifies the amount of fixed inventory slots, up into three slots.
Result
Fails if the argument is empty, or not specified correctly.
On success, players grant fixed slots with the specified amount.

title: Commands/querytarget
summary: Gets transform, name, and id information about the given target entity or entities.

title: Commands/immutableworld
summary: Toggles the world to be able altered or cannot be altered.

title: Commands/globalpause
summary:
Sets or gets the paused state of the game for all players.

Syntax
globalpause <isPaused: bool>
Arguments
isPaused: bool
Specifies the value to pause the world, must in between true or false.
Result
Fails if ...
On success, ...

title: Commands/getchunks
summary:
Syntax
getchunks <dimension: string>
Example usage:
getchunks overworld
Returns an array of arrays.

title: Commands/getspawnpoint
summary:
Syntax
getspawnpoint <player: target>
Arguments
player: target
Specifies the target to get the player spawn point.

title: Commands/geteduclientinfo
summary: Returns information about the game's client.

title: Commands/getchunkdata
summary: Gets pixels for a specific chunk.

title: Commands/executeasself
summary: Similar to /execute, but executes the command to the executor.

title: Commands/executeasother
summary: Executes another command as the specified target.

title: Commands/clearfixedinv
summary: Clears fixed inventory slots.

title: Commands/ability
summary: Sets or queries player with a specific ability.

title: Commands/wsserver
summary:
Stands for "WebSocket server". Used to connect to a WebSocket server which uses command messages to communicate with clients. Used primarily in Education Edition. 
The alias /connect can also be used.

title: Commands/experience
summary: Adds or removes player experience.

title: Commands/worldborder
summary: These commands control the world border.

title: Commands/whitelist
summary: Whitelist is used to manage server whitelists.

title: Commands/weather
summary: Sets the weather.

title: Commands/trigger
summary: Modifies a scoreboard objective with a "trigger" criterion. Allows non-operator players to modify their own scoreboard objectives under tightly controlled conditions. Often used to let players activate systems controlled by data packs or command blocks.

title: Commands/transferserver
summary: Transfer player to another server.

title: Commands/time
summary: Changes or queries the world's game time.

title: Commands/toggledownfall
summary: Toggles the weather.

title: Commands/testforblock
summary: Tests whether a certain block is in a specific location.

title: Commands/testforblocks
summary: Tests whether the blocks in two regions match.

title: Commands/msg
summary: Sends a private message to one or more players. /tell or /w can also be used.

title: Commands/teleport
summary: Teleports entities (players, mobs, etc.).

title: Commands/stop
summary: Stops a server.

title: Commands/stats
summary: Manages the updating of scoreboard objectives with the results of other commands.

title: Commands/spreadplayers
summary: Teleports entities to random surface locations within an area.

title: Commands/setmaxplayers
summary:
Sets the maximum number of players allowed to join a multiplayer game.
This command can be entered in single-player mode, but has no effect until you reopen the world in multiplayer mode.
It has no effect on Realms nor servers.

title: Commands/spawnpoint
summary: Sets the spawn point for a player. It works in all dimensions.

title: Commands/setidletimeout
summary: Sets the time before idle players are kicked from the server.

title: Commands/seed
summary: Displays the world seed.

title: Commands/scoreboard
summary: Manages and displays scores for various scoreboard objectives.

title: Commands/save
summary: These commands manage server saves.

title: Commands/say
summary: Sends a message in the chat.

title: Commands/recipe
summary: Gives or takes (unlocks or locks) recipes for players.

title: Commands/reload
summary: Reloads data packs in Java Edition and functions in behavior packs in Bedrock Edition.

title: Commands/publish
summary: Opens singleplayer world to the local network.

title: Commands/particle
summary: Creates particles.

title: Commands/pardon
summary: Removes entries from the banlist.

title: Commands/op
summary: Grants operator status to a player.

title: Commands/me
summary: Displays a message about yourself.

title: Commands/list
summary: Lists players on the server.

title: Commands/kill
summary: Kills entities (players, mobs, items, etc.).

title: Commands/kick
summary: Kicks a player off the server.

title: Commands/gamerule
summary: Sets or queries a game rule value.

title: Commands/gamemode
summary: Sets a player's game mode.

title: Commands/function
summary: Runs commands founds in the corresponding function file.

title: Commands/entitydata
summary: Modifies the data tag of an entity.

title: Commands/enchant
summary: Adds an enchantment to a player's selected item, subject to the same restrictions as an anvil. Also works on any mob or entity holding a weapon/tool/armor in its main hand.

title: Commands/effect
summary: Add or remove status effects on players and other entities.

title: Commands/difficulty
summary: Sets the difficulty level (peaceful, easy, etc.).

title: Commands/defaultgamemode
summary: Sets the default game mode (creative, survival, etc.) for new players entering a multiplayer server. If in multiplayer and force-gamemode in the server.properties file is true, or if in LAN world, all online players are set to this game mode.

title: Commands/deop
summary: Revokes operator status from a player.

title: Commands/debug
summary: Starts or stops a time profiller session.

title: Commands/clear
summary: Clears items from player inventory, including items being dragged by the player.

title: Commands/blockdata
summary: Modifies the data tag of a block.

title: Commands/advancement
summary: Gives or takes an advancement from one or more players.

title: Amanda Strom
summary: Amanda Ström is a product designer at Mojang Studios.

title: Rikard Herlitz
summary: Rikard Herlitz is the former chief technology officer at Mojang Studios. He joined the company on September 27, 2016, after founding and working as the CTO of Goo Create. On November 10, 2018, Herlitz announced that he was departing from the company, due to him securing the position of Engineering Director for Hangouts Meet in Stockholm.

title: Tobias Ahlin
summary: Tobias Ahlin is the lead experience designer at Mojang Studios. He joined the company on January 2, 2017. Before joining Mojang, he also developed for companies such as Spotify and GitHub.

title: Karim Walldén
summary: Karim Walldén is the head of community relations at Mojang Studios. He joined the company in February 2017.

title: Fredrik Telenius
summary: Fredrik Telenius is a Realms developer at Mojang Studios. He joined the company on May 22, 2017.

title: Filip Thoms
summary: Filip Thoms is an Art Director at Mojang Studios.

title: Torbjorn Allard
summary: Torbjorn Allard is a former web developer at Mojang Studios.

title: Mikaela Prim
summary: Mikaela Prim is a studio manager at Mojang Studios.

title: Nicolette Suraga
summary: Nicolette Suraga is a project manager and brand director at Mojang Studios.

title: Better Together Update
summary: The Better Together Update is an update to Pocket Edition, Windows 10 Edition, Gear VR Edition, Fire TV Edition, and a new version of the game on Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, and PlayStation 4.

title: Java Edition
summary: Minecraft: Java Edition (formerly just Minecraft) is the original version of Minecraft, developed by Mojang Studios for Windows, macOS, and Linux. Notch began development on May 10, 2009, publicly releasing Minecraft on May 17, 2009. The full release of the game (version 1.0.0) was on November 18, 2011, at MINECON 2011.

title: Arthropods
summary: The term arthropod refers to an in-game classification regrouping all bug-like mobs.

title: Tag
summary: Tags in data packs‌ and behavior packs‌ allow players to group different game elements together.

title: Tutorial hints
summary: Tutorial hints are tabs in the right-hand corner of the player's screen which show up when a player starts a world in Survival mode for the first time on a device. They are meant to guide new players who may not know the controls.

title: Crowdin
summary: Crowdin is a cloud-based localization platform used to make projects, such as websites, apps and games, universally accessible through translation.

title: Illusioner
summary: An illusioner is an unused illager that is armed with a bow. They mainly attack by shooting arrows with it, but can also attack with illusion or blindness spells.

title: Marketplace
summary: The Marketplace (Minecraft Store on PlayStation 4) is an in-game store, where players can purchase access to skins, add-ons and worlds from community creators, who in turn get reimbursed for their creations.  Players can access these by spending Minecoins (or Tokens on PlayStation 4), which can be bought with their own currency, or bought directly.

title: Recipe book
summary: The recipe book is a mechanic in Minecraft that serves as a catalog of recipes and as a crafting, smelting, and banner patterning guide.

title: Knowledge Book
summary: A knowledge book is a utility item that reveals available crafting recipes to the player when used.

title: Discovery Update
summary:
The Discovery Update is the name for Minecraft: Pocket Edition version 1.1.0, a major update which was released on June 1, 2017.
The official name for the update, the Discovery Update, was revealed on March 29, 2017, in a blog post on the Minecraft website.
This was the final major update to be labeled under Pocket Edition, before the release of 1.2.0.

title: Parrot
summary: Parrots are rare tameable mobs found in jungles. Parrots can imitate sounds of nearby hostile mobs and can perch on the player's shoulders.

title: Commands/setworldspawn
summary: Sets the world spawn.

title: Agent
summary: In Education Edition and Bedrock Edition worlds connected to a WebSocket server, the agent is a mob that helps players learn coding, by getting players to code the actions on it.

title: World of Color Update
summary: The World of Color Update is the name for Java Edition 1.12, a major update released on June 7, 2017.

title: Mikael Hedberg
summary: Mikael "Slicedlime" Hedberg is a game developer at Mojang Studios since February 1, 2017.

title: Tom Stone
summary: Tom Stone is a former creative communications assistant at Mojang Studios, having started as of January 26, 2017.  He wrote articles for the website's blog. He announced his departure from Mojang in an article on Minecraft.net, but has written articles since.

title: Glazed Terracotta
summary: Glazed terracotta is a vibrant solid block that comes in the 16 regular dye colors, obtained by smelting colored terracotta.

title: Concrete Powder
summary: Concrete powder is a gravity-affected block that is converted to concrete when touching water or lava. It comes in the 16 regular dye colors.

title: Concrete
summary: Concrete is a solid block available in the 16 regular dye colors.

title: Commands/ban
summary: These commands control a server's banlist, or blacklist. A blacklist is a list of players or IP addresses that are not allowed to connect to the server. Bans supersede any whitelisting in place.

title: Nintendo Switch Edition
summary: Minecraft: Nintendo Switch Edition is the edition of Minecraft developed by 4J Studios and Mojang Studios for the Nintendo Switch family of systems.

title: Alexandre Pretto
summary: Alexandre Pretto is a Realms developer at Mojang Studios, who started at the company on January 12, 2017.

title: Fire TV Edition
summary: Minecraft: Fire TV Edition was the former title of Bedrock Edition designed specifically for the Amazon Fire TV.

title: Gear VR Edition
summary: Minecraft: Gear VR Edition was the former title of the version of Bedrock Edition designed for virtual reality on certain Samsung Galaxy devices through the Samsung Gear VR headset. It was released on April 27, 2016. Although Pocket Edition on the Galaxy Store was discontinued later on, Gear VR Edition was never made free to owners of Pocket Edition on that platform.

title: Apple TV Edition
summary: Minecraft: Apple TV Edition was the version of Bedrock Edition designed to run on the Apple TV.

title: Sweeping Edge
summary: Sweeping Edge is a sword enchantment that increases sweep attack damage.

title: Iron Nugget
summary: Iron nuggets are pieces of iron that can be obtained by smelting iron tools/weapons or iron/chainmail armor. One iron nugget is worth one-ninth of an iron ingot.

title: Overworld Update
summary:
The Overworld Update is the name for Minecraft: Pocket Edition version Alpha v0.14.0, a major update released on February 18, 2016.
The official name for the update, the Overworld Update, was revealed on February 10, 2016 in a blog post on the Xbox website.

title: Allow and Deny
summary: Allow and deny blocks can be used to create restricted building areas or areas where users can build.

title: Ender Update
summary:
The Ender Update is the name for Minecraft: Pocket Edition version 1.0.0, a major update that was released on December 19, 2016.
The Apple TV Edition and the Fire TV Edition were released with this version.
The official name for the update, the Ender Update, was revealed on November 11, 2016, in a blog post on the Mojang website.

title: Mariana Graham
summary: Mariana Graham, better known as RazzleberryFox, previously worked at Mojang Studios as Animator, Modeler and Texture Artist since October 17, 2016. She is well known for creating the DecoCraft mod, as well as contributing models and artwork to many other mods. She is a content creator for the Minecraft Marketplace.

title: Curse of Vanishing
summary: Curse of Vanishing is an enchantment that causes the item to disappear upon death.

title: Curse of Binding
summary: Curse of Binding is an enchantment that prevents removal of a cursed item from its armor slot.

title: Maria Lemón
summary: Maria Lemón is a former Mojang Studios Game Developer who worked on Java Edition.

title: Commands/locate
summary: Displays the coordinates for the closest generated structure or biomes of a given type in the chat for the player who executed the command. In Java Edition, it can also display for the closest points of interest.

title: Illager
summary: An illager is a type of hostile mob that regularly spawns in woodland mansions, patrols, raids, and pillager outposts. All illagers are hostile toward players, villagers (excluding baby villagers), wandering traders and iron golems.

title: Explorer Map
summary: An explorer map is a special map used to aid in finding rare generated structures, including woodland mansions, ocean monuments, and buried treasures.

title: Llama
summary:
A llama is a tamable neutral mob used to transport large shipments of items.
A trader llama is a special variant that follows wandering traders.

title: Vindicator
summary: A vindicator is an illager equipped with an iron axe. Vindicators appear in woodland mansions and participate in raids. It sprints towards its targets to attack them with its axe.

title: Vex
summary: The vex is a small flying hostile mob. It wields an iron sword, can phase through walls, and is only summoned as one of the evoker's attacks. They attack by lunging at their targets with their sword.

title: Evoker
summary: An evoker is a spell-casting illager found in woodland mansions and raids, and is the only source of the totem of undying. It uses two spells to attack; one that summons armor-piercing fangs and one that summons vexes.

title: Woodland Mansion
summary: A woodland mansion is a massive systematically-generated structure found in dark forests, often far away from the world spawn point. A mansion is inhabited by evokers and vindicators, and is one of the few places where a totem of undying can be obtained, aside from raids. Besides illager mobs, a mansion's interior lighting is sufficiently low for other overworld monsters to spawn.

title: Totem of Undying
summary: A totem of undying is an uncommon combat item that can save holders from death. It is dropped by evokers, which spawn in woodland mansions and raids.

title: Shulker Shell
summary: Shulker shells are items dropped by shulkers that are used solely to craft shulker boxes.

title: Shulker Box
summary: A shulker box is a block that can store and transport items.

title: Exploration Update
summary: The Exploration Update is the name for Java Edition version 1.11, a major update released on November 14, 2016.

title: Portfolio
summary: A portfolio is an item that can save photos taken with a camera.

title: Border
summary: Border blocks are unbreakable blocks that prohibit movement through, over or under them. They are exclusive to Minecraft Education and Bedrock Edition.

title: Boss Update
summary: The Boss Update is the name for Minecraft: Pocket Edition version Alpha v0.16.0, an update that was released on October 21, 2016.

title: Robert Sjödahl
summary: Robert Sjodahl is a web developer at Mojang Studios.

title: Ulrika Hojgard
summary: Ulrika Hojgard is a Chief Operations Officer at Mojang Studios.

title: Adam Martinsson
summary: Adam Martinsson is a content coordinator and one of the member of the Content Team of Mojang Studios.

title: Cim Borg
summary: Cim Borg is a former customer support agent at Mojang Studios.

title: Josefina Axelsson
summary: Josefina Axelsson is a Senior Financial Accountant at Mojang Studios.

title: Maria Malone
summary: Maria Malone is a brand enforcer at Mojang Studios.

title: Marcus Forss
summary: Marcus Forss is a customer support agent at Mojang Studios.

title: Commands/stopsound
summary: Stops a given sound.

title: Agnes Larsson
summary: Agnes Larsson (born June 13, 1989) is a Vanilla Minecraft Game Director at Mojang Studios.

title: Mini games
summary: Mini games are a variety of modes exclusive to the Legacy Console Edition of Minecraft.

title: Project Malmö
summary: Project Malmö is the first and only mod supported by Mojang. It allows players to view and edit the Minecraft code.

title: Damage/Mobs
summary: The damage mobs deal to players is affected by the difficulty of the game.

title: Chalkboard
summary: A chalkboard is a block that can display more text than a sign. Three sizes are available: 1×1 (slate), 2×1 (poster), and 3×2 (board).

title: Frostburn Update
summary:
The Frostburn Update is the name for Java Edition 1.10, a major update released on 
June 8, 2016.

title: Friendly Update
summary:
The Friendly Update is the name for Minecraft: Pocket Edition version Alpha v0.15.0, a major update released on June 10, 2016 for Android, and June 13, 2016 across all platforms.
The official name for the update, the Friendly Update, was revealed on June 3, 2016 in a blog post on the Mojang website.

title: Observer
summary: An observer is a block that emits a redstone signal when the block or fluid it faces experiences a change.

title: Walking
summary: Walking is one of the fundamental methods of transportation in Minecraft, allowing for a reasonable movement speed while avoiding the hunger impact of sprinting, but without the fall safety of sneaking.

title: Structure Block file format
summary: Structure files are stored as an NBT file.

title: Structure Void
summary: A structure void is an invisible block that allows existing blocks to remain unchanged rather than be overridden when using the structure block to load a structure.

title: Fossil
summary: A fossil is a rarely-occurring skeletal feature composed of bone blocks, coal ore, or diamond ore.

title: Nether Wart Block
summary:
Nether wart blocks are decorative blocks found in crimson forests and crafted using nether wart.
Warped wart blocks are a turquoise variant found in warped forests, but cannot be crafted unlike nether wart block.

title: Bone Block
summary: Bone blocks are storage blocks equivalent to nine pieces of bone meal.

title: Stray
summary: A stray is a variant of a skeleton that spawns in a few snow-covered biomes. They behave similarly to skeletons, except they fire tipped arrows of Slowness from their bows.

title: Magma Block
summary: A magma block is a light-emitting naturally-occurring block found in the Nether and the Overworld. It causes continuous damage while being stepped on, considered fire damage, except it does not light mobs on fire.

title: Husk
summary: A husk is a variant of a zombie that spawns in deserts. They function similar to zombies, except they do not burn in sunlight and inflict Hunger with their unarmed attacks.

title: Marsh Davies
summary: Marsh Davies is a former creative communications manager at Mojang Studios. On April 27, 2018, he announced his departure from Mojang.

title: Stefan Torstensson
summary: Stefan Torstensson is a web developer working at Mojang Studios.

title: Tinted Glass
summary: Tinted glass is a block that blocks light while being visually transparent.

title: Commands/title
summary: Controls text displayed on the screen.

title: Polar Bear
summary: Polar bears are neutral mobs that live in icy biomes.

title: Olof Carlson
summary: Olof Carlson is a Realms developer at Mojang Studios, who started at the company on March 29, 2016.

title: Christian Westman
summary: Christian Westman is a retired game developer at Mojang Studios, who started at the company on April 3, 2016.

title: JSON
summary:
JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) is a lightweight data-interchange format.
In Minecraft, JSON format is used to store the following data:

Text in written books, signs, custom names and the /tellraw, /title, /bossbar, /scoreboard and /team commands.‌
The pack.mcmeta file that describes a Java Edition resource pack and data pack.
The manifest.json file that describes a Bedrock Edition add-on.
Files in a resource pack that define models, sound events, UI, etc.‌
Files in a behavior pack that define entity behaviors, block behaviors, item behaviors, etc.‌
Advancements and statistics (as .minecraft/saves/*/data/stats/*.json)
The profile data for the launcher (as .minecraft/launcher_profiles.json)
Information about downloaded versions (as .minecraft/versions/*/*.json)
Files in a data pack that define advancements, loot tables, tags, recipes, dimensions, dimension types and predicates‌.

title: Commands/replaceitem
summary: Replaces the items in a specified slot of either a block's (chest, furnaces, etc.) or entity's (players or mobs) inventory, with a specified item.

title: Philip Vieira
summary: Philip 'Zee' Vieira is a former Realms developer at Mojang Studios.

title: Martin Johansson
summary: Martin Johansson is working as Art Director at Mojang Studios.

title: Ninni Landin
summary: Ninni Landin is the art director of Mojang Studios. She was hired by Mojang in October 2015, became lead artist in February 2017 and finally art director in June 2018.

title: Garry Lucken
summary: Garry Lucken, also known as Army of Trolls, is a Pixel artist notable for his work on the Skin packs in Minecraft. Lucken's work includes the City and Town Folk Skin packs in Pocket Edition and has assisted with various Skin packs in Console Edition.

title: Jason Major
summary: Jason Major is a former member of the Minecraft Redmond studio and a developer for Bedrock Edition.

title: Wii U Edition
summary: Minecraft: Wii U Edition was the edition of Minecraft developed by 4J Studios and Mojang Studios for the Wii U.

title: Block by Block
summary: Block by Block is a charity set up in 2012 by Mojang to support the United Nations Human Settlements Programme (UN-Habitat)’s work with public space and Minecraft. The purpose of Block by Block is to raise funds for the improvement of public spaces worldwide, with a focus on poor communities in developing countries.

title: Metal
summary:
A metal is a lustrous, conductive, and generally strong and workable material. There currently exist three different metals within Minecraft:

Copper
Gold
Iron
There also exists one alloy:

Netherite

title: Dual wield
summary: Dual wielding is a gameplay mechanic that allows players to hold two items or blocks‌ simultaneously.

title: Chorus plant
summary: A chorus plant is a plant-like feature that generates in the highlands of the outer End islands.

title: Adrian Östergård
summary: Adrian Östergård is a product owner of Minecraft: Java Edition at Mojang Studios.

title: Elli Ashrafi
summary: Elli Ashrafi is a customer support agent at Mojang Studios.

title: Josefin Olsson
summary: Josefin Olsson is a customer support agent at Mojang Studios.

title: Luck
summary: Luck is a status effect that makes it more likely to receive better loot from certain loot tables, contrary to Bad Luck.

title: Bad Luck
summary: Bad Luck, also known as Unluck, is a status effect that decreases the chance of the player getting high-quality loot, contrary to Luck.

title: Johan Aronson
summary: Johan Aronson is the Studio Art Director at Mojang Studios.

title: Loot table
summary: Loot tables are technical JSON files that are used to dictate what items should generate in various situations, such as what items should be in naturally generated containers, what items should drop when breaking a block or killing a mob, what items can be fished, and more. It does not affect dropped experience, or dropped non-item entities such as slimes from larger slimes or silverfish from infested blocks.

title: Igloo
summary: Igloos are structures that are naturally generated in snowy biomes. They are small round structures constructed primarily of snow blocks.

title: Frosted Ice
summary: Frosted ice is a translucent solid block.

title: Frost Walker
summary: Frost Walker is an enchantment to boots that creates frosted ice blocks when walking over water, and causes the wearer to be immune to damage from certain blocks such as campfires and magma blocks when stepped on.

title: Mending
summary: Mending is an enchantment that restores durability of an item using experience.

title: Elytra
summary: Elytra ( /ˈɛl ɪ trə/ ᴇʟ-i-trə) are rare wings found in end ships that are a source of flight in Survival mode.

title: Thomas Guimbretière
summary: Thomas "ProfMobius" Guimbretière is a former game developer working at Mojang Studios. He worked on Minecraft and is well known for co-founding the Mod Coder Pack alongside Michael Stoyke. He has also made many mods for Minecraft, with two of his most notable mods being Waila and Jabba.

title: Xbox Game Studios
summary: Xbox Game Studios, formerly Microsoft Studios, is an American video game publisher and division of Microsoft. The company acquired Mojang Studios, developers of Minecraft, on November 6, 2014 for US$2.5 billion. The studio helped with cross platform play across various editions of Minecraft, including mobile, PC and console versions. The studio also currently manages the Bedrock Edition of the game.

title: Sound
summary: Sounds are an auditory output of the game intended to communicate the happening of certain events.

title: Black Dye
summary: Black dye is a primary color dye similar to an ink sac.

title: Brynjólfur Erlingsson
summary: Brynjólfur 'Binni' Erlingsson is the data warehouse manager at Mojang Studios.

title: Isabella Balk
summary: Isabella Balk has been an office manager at Mojang Studios since November 2014. Previously, she worked at Talentum events, Butikssäljare, and Bar och Restaurangchef.

title: Bella
summary: Bella 'Broontoo'  is a former project manager at Mojang Studios.

title: World size
summary: World size is an option to change the size of the finite worlds in New Nintendo 3DS Edition and Legacy Console Edition (specific to Xbox One Edition, PlayStation 4 Edition,  and Nintendo Switch Edition). By default, worlds generate at the largest size available in each edition.

title: MinecraftEdu
summary: MinecraftEdu is a sandbox indie educational video game written in Java, developed by TeacherGaming, published by E-Line Media, and licensed by Mojang Studios.

title: Shield
summary: A shield is a tool used for protecting the player against attacks.

title: Lingering Potion
summary: Lingering potions are variants of splash potions that can be thrown to leave clouds with status effects that linger on the ground in an area.

title: Dragon's Breath
summary: The dragon's breath is a brewing item that is used solely to make lingering potions.

title: End Portal (block)
summary: The end portal block is a block generated when an end portal or exit portal is activated, which teleports the player between the Overworld and the End.

title: Obsidian Boat
summary: The obsidian boat was a joke boat variant released in an April Fools' joke version.

title: End Gateway (block)
summary: The end gateway is a block that forms a part of end gateways, which teleport the player between the main island and the outer islands in the End.

title: Levitation
summary: Levitation is a status effect that causes entities to levitate, inflicted when entities are shot by shulkers.

title: Structure Block
summary: A structure block is used to generate structures manually. They can also be used to save and load structures, alongside structure void blocks.

title: Glowing
summary: Glowing is a status effect that shows entity positions through blocks.

title: End gateway
summary: End gateways are portals generated in the End: some are spawned around the central island by defeating the ender dragon multiple times; others are randomly generated throughout the outer islands.

title: Popped Chorus Fruit
summary: Popped chorus fruit is an item obtained by smelting chorus fruit, and used to craft end rods and purpur blocks. Unlike raw chorus fruit, the popped fruit is inedible.

title: Purpur Block
summary:
Purpur blocks and purpur pillars are decorative blocks that are naturally generated in end cities and end ships.
Chiseled purpur and smooth purpur are two further variants of purpur blocks exclusive to Bedrock Edition that can be accessed only by commands, and appear identical to regular purpur blocks.

title: End Stone Bricks
summary: End stone bricks are an end stone-based brick.

title: Chorus Flower
summary: Chorus flowers are plants that are found in the End. They grow on chorus plants.

title: End City
summary: End cities are castle-like structures found on the outer islands of the End. They are inhabited by shulkers and hold loot among the most valuable in the game.

title: End Rod
summary: An end rod is a decorative light source that emits white particles.

title: Shulker
summary: A shulker is a box-shaped hostile mob found in end cities. It hides in its shell to protect itself and blend in with its surroundings. It attacks by shooting homing bullets at the player which inflict Levitation. It is the only source of shulker shells, which are used to craft shulker boxes.

title: Texture Pack DLC
summary: In Bedrock, Legacy Console, and New Nintendo 3DS editions, texture packs are available as downloadable content that can be bought from the Xbox 360 or One Marketplace/PlayStation Store/Nintendo eShop or from the downloadable content section of the game, in addition to the default texture pack that comes with the game. Texture packs usually cost US$2.99 each or equivalent to 490, however trial versions are available. On the Xbox 360 and PS3 versions, some of the newer Mash-Up packs are not available, along with exclusive content for Sony and Microsoft platforms.

title: Opacity/Placement
summary: Many transparent blocks exhibit unique behavior when it comes to being placed or being placed on. This page covers only those blocks that exhibit unique behavior. For example, glass is not covered as everything can be placed on it. In addition, only blocks that need some sort of support are covered in the columns.

title: Chorus Plant (block)
summary: Chorus plants are blocks that naturally generate on the outer islands of the End. They can be grown using chorus flowers.

title: Chorus Fruit
summary: Chorus fruit is a food item native to the End that can be eaten, or smelted into popped chorus fruit. It can be eaten even when the hunger bar is full, and eating it may teleport the player up to 8 blocks in any direction.

title: Windows 10 Edition
summary: Minecraft: Windows 10 Edition was the former title of Bedrock Edition for the universal Windows 10 platform developed by Mojang Studios and Xbox Game Studios.

title: Missing textures and models
summary: Minecraft makes use of missing textures and missing models to handle potential errors present in the game's resources as well as resource packs.

title: Indev House
summary: The Indev House was a structure which acted as the starting place when first spawned in a Java Edition Indev world.

title: Legend of the Chambered
summary: Legend of the Chambered (LoC) or simply Chambered is a series of raycaster styled games created by Markus "Notch" Persson where the player must explore winding stone chambers, fight monsters, and reach the end of the dungeon.

title: Andreas Andersson
summary: Andreas Andersson is a former customer support agent at Mojang Studios.

title: Mattias Victorin
summary: Mattias Victorin is a former customer support agent at Mojang Studios.

title: Marina Kostesic
summary: Marina Kostesic is the senior financial accountant at Mojang Studios.

title: Resource pack/Folders
summary: This list is used by both Client.jar, Data pack, and Resource pack.

summary: This table summarizes the average quantity of each item that can be found in a naturally-generated chest, depending on its location.

title: Combat Update
summary: The Combat Update is the name for Java Edition version 1.9, a major update released on Monday, February 29, 2016.

title: Tomas Alaeus
summary: Tomas Alaeus is a former member of Mojang Studios.

title: Commands/give
summary: Gives an item to one or more players.

title: Commands/fill
summary: Fills all or parts of a region with a specific block.

title: Daniel Wustenhoff
summary: Daniel "darngeek" Wustenhoff is a former member of Mojang Studios. He was a developer for Bedrock Edition and Minecraft Dungeons.

title: Milla Stone
summary: Milla Stone is a brand enforcer at Mojang Studios.

title: Brandon Andersson
summary: Brandon Andersson is a brand enforcer at Mojang Studios.

title: Talia Grunt
summary: Talia Grunt is a brand enforcer at Mojang Studios.

title: Karl Lowry
summary: Karl Lowry is an ex-brand enforcer at Mojang Studios.

title: Meat
summary:
Meat is a type of food which can be eaten by the player or wolves:

Beef (Cooked), a meat from cows
Pork (Cooked), a meat from pigs and hoglins
Chicken (Cooked), a potentially poisonous meat from chickens
Cod (Cooked), a common meat obtained through fishing
Salmon (Cooked), a common meat obtained through fishing
Mutton (Cooked), a meat from sheep
Rabbit (Cooked), a meat from rabbits
Rotten Flesh, a meat from zombies, zombified piglins, drowned, husk and zombie horses.
Tropical Fish, a rare fish (inedible)
Pufferfish, a toxic uncommon fish (inedible)

title: Siri Hoel Andersson
summary: Siri Hoel is the Facility Manager in the Workplace Experience Team at Mojang Studios.

title: Shoghi Cervantes
summary: Shoghi Cervantes is a member of Mojang Studios.

title: David Stuart Dahlgren
summary: David Stuart Dahlgren is a customer support agent at Mojang Studios.

title: Dirt Path
summary: Dirt paths are decorative blocks. They are mainly found in villages.

title: Skeleton Horse
summary: A skeleton horse is an undead variant of the horse. It sometimes spawns when lightning strikes.

title: Demo mode/Locations
summary: Because the geography of the demo world never changes (demo always uses the seed -343522682), the locations of various landmarks may be put on this page. These can help act as a guide for Minecraft players who are exploring the demo world. This page only lists landmarks that are within 3,000 blocks of the point 0,0.

title: Sarah Mårtensson
summary: Sarah Mårtensson is a customer support agent at Mojang Studios.

title: Telltale Games
summary: Telltale Games (formerly known as Telltale, Incorporated) was an American independent digital publisher based in San Rafael, California.

title: Commands/execute
summary: /execute executes another command but allows changing the executor, changing the position and angle it is executed at, adding preconditions, and storing its result.

title: Ocean Monument/Structure
summary: The ocean monument is constructed entirely from variants of prismarine and lit by sea lanterns.

title: Small Fireball
summary: A small fireball is a projectile produced by ranged attack of blazes, and by fire charges when shot from dispensers.

title: Exit portal
summary: The exit portal (also known as the end podium or end fountain) is a feature that enables the player to return to their spawn point, activating upon each defeat of the ender dragon.

title: Spring
summary: A spring is a feature of a single unit of liquid that generates within the world, flowing out into spaces level with or lower than the source.

title: Achievement/Legacy Console and New Nintendo 3DS editions
Water/FS
summary:
Java Edition:

title: Lava/FS
summary:

title: Mushroom Block
summary: A mushroom block is a solid block that makes up a huge mushroom, which consists of a mushroom stem and brown mushroom blocks or red mushroom blocks, depending on the color of the huge mushroom.

title: Pär Axelsson
summary: Pär Axelsson is a web developer working at Mojang Studios. He joined Mojang in December 2013.

title: Matilda Åkerman
summary: Matilda Åkerman is a brand enforcer at Mojang Studios.

title: Olle Personne
summary: Olle Personne is a part of the intellectual property enforcement team at Mojang Studios.

title: Bonus chest
summary: The bonus chest is a feature that appears near the player's spawn if the "Bonus chest" option is toggled on the main menu. It generates with a semi-random collection of basic items to help the player survive early on and gather necessary resources, including tools, blocks, and food.

title: Pink Wither
summary: The pink wither or friendly wither was a recurring April Fools' mob present in both Java Edition 2.0 and 15w14a.

title: Coral
summary:
Coral is a type of non-solid block that comes in five variants: tube, brain, bubble, fire, and horn.
 Dead coral is the dead variants of coral.

title: Instant Damage
summary: Instant Damage is an instant status effect that decreases health for players and living mobs and heals the undead.

title: Experience/Before 14w02a
summary: The first 16 levels are linear (17 XP points per level), while level 17+ require more points per level compared to the prior level.

title: Commands/clone
summary: Clones blocks from one region to another.

title: Bountiful Update
summary: The Bountiful Update is the name for Java Edition version 1.8, a major update that was released on Tuesday, September 2, 2014.

title: Mash-up pack
summary: Mash-up packs are used in Bedrock, Legacy Console, and New Nintendo 3DS editions as the equivalent of a resource pack in the original edition of Minecraft.

title: Armor Stand
summary: Armor stands are entities that are able to hold and display wearable items.

title: Block states
summary: Block states (also known as block properties) are extra pieces of data that further define a block, such as how it appears or behaves.

title: Old
summary: Old was a world type exclusive to Bedrock Edition and Minecraft Education. The purpose of this world type was to provide smaller worlds on older or low-end devices that did not perform well with infinite worlds.

title: Banner
summary: Banners are tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes and banner patterns.

title: Undead
summary: Undead, by definition, refers to an entity that is dead, but still animate.

title: Rabbit Stew
summary: Rabbit stew is a food item that can be eaten by the player.

title: Raw Mutton
summary: Raw mutton is a food item dropped by sheep when killed.

title: Cooked Mutton
summary: Cooked mutton is a food item obtained from cooking raw mutton.

title: Cooked Rabbit
summary: Cooked rabbit is a food item that can be eaten by the player.
