title: Raw Rabbit
summary: Raw rabbit is a food item that can be eaten by the player, or cooked in a furnace or a campfire to make cooked rabbit.

title: Rabbit's Foot
summary: A rabbit's foot is a brewing item obtained from rabbits.

title: Rabbit Hide
summary: Rabbit hide is an item dropped by rabbits.

title: Debug mode
summary: Debug mode usually refers to a world preset used to test block states, block models, and textures.

title: Model
summary:
Models are three-dimensional shapes used in Minecraft which are used to display objects encountered in the game.
In Java Edition, the models pertaining to the vast majority of blocks and items can be configured, as well as those of a small selection of entities.

title: Elder Guardian
summary: An elder guardian is a stronger and larger variant of the guardian. It attacks by firing beams at the player, while retaliating at melee attacks with its spikes and applying Mining Fatigue to all in their monument. It is the largest aquatic mob in Minecraft, as well as the strongest. Three of them spawn inside an ocean monument; one in the top room and one in each wing.

title: Depth Strider
summary: Depth Strider is a boot enchantment that increases underwater movement speed.

title: Prismarine Crystals
summary: Prismarine crystals are items obtained by defeating guardians or elder guardians. They are used along with prismarine shards to craft sea lanterns.

title: Prismarine Shard
summary: A prismarine shard is an item obtained by defeating guardians or elder guardians. It can be used to craft various prismarine blocks as well as sea lanterns.

title: Etho Slab
summary: The etho slab is a joke slab introduced exclusively in Java Edition 2.0. It is a reference to the YouTube channel EthosLab.

title: Ocean Monument
summary: Ocean monuments, also known as simply monuments, are rare underwater structures found in deep oceans biome and variants. They are inhabited by guardians and elder guardians. They are the only place where sponges can be found and one of the two places where prismarine can be found; the other being ocean ruins.

title: Guardian
summary: Guardians are pufferfish-like hostile mobs that spawn in and around ocean monuments. They attack by firing beams at the player and retaliate when attacked by a melee attack with their spikes.

title: Sea Lantern
summary: A sea lantern is an underwater light source that appears in ocean monuments and underwater ruins.

title: Rabbit
summary: A rabbit is an uncommon passive mob and is a source of rabbit's foot, rabbit hide and raw rabbit.

title: Prismarine
summary: Prismarine is a type of stone that appears underwater in ruins and ocean monuments.

title: Target selectors
summary: Target selectors are used in commands to select players and entities arbitrarily, without needing to specify an exact player name or a UUID.

title: Jockey
summary: Jockey, by definition, refers to an entity riding another entity.

title: Anvil mechanics
summary: This page explains the mechanics of the anvil.

title: Anna Lundgren
summary: Anna Lundgren is a brand enforcer at Mojang Studios.

title: Nasim Derakhshan
summary: Nasim Derakhshan is a Customer Relationship Expert at Mojang Studios.

title: David Marby
summary: David 'NeonMaster' Marby is the former Realms Tech Lead at Mojang Studios from May 2014 to April 2017.

title: Generated structures data file format
summary: The Village.dat, Fortress.dat, Temple.dat, Mineshaft.dat, Stronghold.dat, Monument.dat, EndCity.dat, and Mansion.dat files are located in the data folder of a Minecraft level and store information about the generation of villages, Nether fortresses, desert and jungle pyramids and witch huts and Igloos, mineshafts, strongholds, ocean monuments, end cities, and woodland mansions respectively, in the level. The structure data is stored in the chunk data.

title: World boundary
summary: The world boundary is the area defining the intended spatial edges of a Minecraft dimension. It is distinct from hard limits, which are defined by limitations of the programming language itself.

title: World border
summary: The world border is the current edge of a Minecraft dimension.

title: Old Customized
summary: Customized, retroactively labelled Old Customized by later game versions, was a world type that replaced the normal varied terrain of the Overworld with custom features. Because, as of snapshot 18w06a, it was removed completely due to the rewrite of the world generation, it was then replaced by a new, easy-to-customize but considerably more limited substitute world type called Buffet. Custom worlds returned in 20w21a, though they are completely different; this version also renamed this world type to Old Customized.

title: Custom
summary: Custom is a world type that allows users to change the generation of the Overworld, Nether, and End dimensions as well as the ability to create custom dimensions. It is edited using a JSON file that is imported on the world creation screen.

title: Sounds.json
summary: sounds.json (sound_definitions.json in Bedrock Edition) is a file used by the sound system in resource packs which tells the sound system what sound files to play when a sound event is triggered by one or more in-game events.

title: Minecraft Books
summary: The Official Minecraft Books are a series of guidebooks for Minecraft, written for new and inexperienced players while being high-quality enough for collectors. The books are written by various authors.

title: Endermite
summary: An endermite is the smallest hostile mob. An endermite may spawn when a player throws an ender pearl. They attack by biting the player. Endermen are hostile toward endermites.

title: Realms Plus
summary: Minecraft Realms Plus is an official subscription-based server hosting service that allows players to create and manage their own private Minecraft servers. Hosted by Mojang, Realms Plus provides an easy and fast way to create servers and allows the owner to manage them from inside the game, without prior knowledge of the concepts for hosting on the Internet. Realms Plus also allows players to choose from a list of content curated by Mojang, which is updated approximately every month. Realms Plus is not intended for large public servers, but groups of friends or as a family server.

title: Falling Block
summary: A falling block is the entity form of a block that appears when a gravity-affected block loses its support.

title: Health Boost
summary: Health Boost is an unused status effect that increases a player's (or mob's) maximum health.

title: Blindness
summary: Blindness is a status effect that impairs the player's vision. It can be cast by illusioners‌ or by consuming suspicious stew.

title: Night Vision
summary: Night Vision is a status effect that enhances the player's ability to see in darkness and underwater.

title: Mining Fatigue
summary: Mining Fatigue is an effect that reduces mining and attack speed, opposite to Haste.

title: Slowness
summary: Slowness is an effect that decreases walking speed.

title: Jump Boost
summary: Jump Boost is a status effect that temporarily increases the jump height of the player.

title: Strength
summary: Strength is an effect which increases attack power.

title: Haste
summary: Haste is a status effect that increases attack speed by 10% per level and increases mining speed by 20% per level. Negative levels decrease mining and attack speed, similar to Mining Fatigue.

title: Weakness
summary: Weakness is a status effect that decreases attack power. It can be cured by a milk bucket or with elixir‌.

title: Spectator
summary: Spectator mode is a game mode that allows the player to fly around and observe the world without interacting with it in any way.

title: Barrier
summary: Barrier is an invisible block used to create solid boundaries.

title: Commands/playsound
summary: Plays a specified sound at a player, in a location, and in a specific volume and pitch.

title: Regeneration
summary: Regeneration is a status effect that restores a player's (or mob's) health over time.

title: Fire Resistance
summary: Fire Resistance is a status effect that grants the affected player/mob complete immunity to all sources of fire damage.

title: Nausea
summary: Nausea is an effect that warps and wobbles the player's vision similar to a nether portal. The effect does not change its power as its potency changes. It can be obtained only from eating a pufferfish. Drinking milk removes the effect. In Bedrock and Education editions, it can also be cured with tonic.

title: Advancement
summary: Advancements are a way to gradually guide new players into Minecraft and give them challenges to complete, similar to the basic system of achievements in Bedrock Edition.

title: Andesite
summary:
Andesite is a block of igneous rock, most often found in large pockets in the ground.
 Polished andesite is the polished version of andesite.

title: Diorite
summary:
Diorite is a block of igneous rock, found in large pockets in the ground.
 Polished diorite is the polished version of diorite.

title: Slime Block
summary: A slime block is a storage block equivalent to nine slimeballs. It has both sticky and bouncy properties making it useful in conjunction with pistons to move both blocks and entities.

title: Granite
summary:
Granite is a block of igneous rock, found in large pockets in the ground.
 Polished granite is the polished version of granite.

title: Spawn chunk
summary: Spawn chunks are chunks found at the world spawn point which are always loaded in memory, unlike normal chunks which unload when no players are nearby.

title: Absorption
summary: Absorption is a status effect that pads the health bar with extra hearts.

title: Nether Portal (block)
summary: The nether portal block is the translucent part of the nether portal that teleports the player to and from the Nether.

title: Chicken Jockey
summary: Chicken jockeys are the rare appearance of a baby zombie, baby zombified piglin, baby zombie villager, baby husk, or baby drowned riding a chicken.

title: Fireball
summary: A fireball is an explosive projectile expelled from a ghast as its method of attack.

title: Blue Dye
summary: Blue dye is a primary dye color.

title: Music
summary: Minecraft contains many music tracks, which play at various points in game, including the main menu, in Creative mode, in the Nether, in the End, and during the credits.

title: Beetroot Seeds
summary:
Beetroot seeds are items that can be used to plant beetroot crops.
Beetroot crops are planted in farmland and used to grow beetroot and beetroot seeds.

title: Beetroot Soup
summary: Beetroot soup is an unstackable food item.

title: Beetroot
summary: A beetroot is a food and dye ingredient.

title: Obsidian wall
summary: Obsidian walls were an experimental and short-lived debugging structure made of obsidian. They were introduced in a version Infdev released on February 27th, 2010 and were removed a short time later.

title: Brick pyramid
summary: Brick pyramids were tall, experimental generated structures made up exclusively of bricks.

title: Ryan Holtz
summary: Ryan Holtz is a former game developer at Mojang Studios who worked on the rendering engine of Minecraft. His employment at Mojang was announced on November 2, 2013 at the "Future of Minecraft" panel at MINECON 2013. His first day at the Mojang office was November 18, 2013.

title: Tomas Sommar
summary: Tomas Sommar is a former web developer who worked at Mojang Studios.

title: Michael Stoyke
summary: Michael "Searge" Stoyke is a game developer working at Mojang Studios. He is currently working on Minecraft. His employment at Mojang was announced on November 2, 2013 at the "Future of Minecraft" panel at MINECON 2013. His first day at the Mojang office was January 2, 2014. He is most well known for founding the Mod Coder Pack. He is the founding member of ModJam and was known for his 'secret feature' game where he adds secret features, mainly command block ones, to the game in secret and waits for users to find them and report them on Twitter. On February 13, 2015, Searge announced on Twitter that the 'secret feature' game would stop when snapshots are released for Java Edition 1.9, claiming that it was getting 'a bit old'.

title: Hampus Nilsson
summary: Hampus Nilsson is the customer support manager at Mojang Studios. He joined the company in January 2013, but assumed the lead role when Marc Watson's job capacity changed.

title: Lisa Kempe
summary: Lisa Kempe is a project manager at Mojang Studios since September 2015. From January 2013 to September 2015, she worked as a customer support agent.

title: Minecraft - Volume Beta
summary: Minecraft - Volume Beta is the second Minecraft soundtrack album by C418, the first being Minecraft - Volume Alpha.

title: Dark oak
summary: A dark oak tree is a variant of the oak tree with a thick trunk. They are found in the dark forest biome.

title: Forest rock
summary: A forest rock is a feature found throughout old growth taiga biomes.

title: The Update that Changed the World
summary: The Update that Changed the World is the name for Java Edition version 1.7.2, a major update released on October 25, 2013.

title: Jonas Mårtensson
summary: Jonas Mårtensson is the chief executive officer of Mojang Studios. He joined the company as vice president on October 2, 2013, when his twin brother and the CEO of Mojang, Carl Manneh, announced his recruitment. With the acquisition of Mojang by Microsoft in November of 2014 and the subsequent retirement of his brother, he assumed the position of CEO.

title: Commands/setblock
summary: Changes a block to another block.

title: Heart of the Sea
summary: A heart of the sea is a rare item that can be crafted into a conduit.

title: Minecart with Command Block
summary: A minecart with command block is an impulse‌ or repeating‌ command block inside a minecart.

title: Commands/tellraw
summary: Sends a JSON message to players.

title: Shaders
summary: Shaders are used to define the game's rendering of certain elements.

title: Shaders/Before 1.9
summary: Shaders are a feature used for various effects in Spectator Mode when the player takes the viewpoint of a mob.

title: Water Breathing
summary: Water breathing is a status effect that prevents or delays drowning, and allows waterlogged beds‌ to be used. It also prevents or delays squid, glow squid, salmon, cod, pufferfish, tropical fish, and tadpoles from taking suffocation damage from being on land.‌

title: Luck of the Sea
summary: Luck of the Sea is an enchantment to a fishing rod that increases luck while fishing.

title: Acacia
summary: The acacia tree is found in the savanna biome. Acacia trees are around 8 blocks tall and feature distinct diagonal trunks, and may occasionally have multiple canopies.

title: Lure
summary: Lure is a fishing rod enchantment that decreases the wait time for a bite on the hook.

title: Dark Forest
summary: A dark forest is a temperate forested biome. It is known for its thick, dense leaf canopies that block light sufficiently to allow hostile mobs to spawn during the daytime.

title: Snowy Taiga
summary: A snowy taiga is a snow-covered biome that comprises a forest of spruce trees, ferns and large ferns, usually generating adjacent to or within snowy plains.

title: Biome/Before 1.18
summary: In Java Edition 1.18 and Bedrock Edition 1.18.0, Overworld terrain generation was rewritten to become more varied and independent of biome generation. This made many biome variants that were in the game redundant, as the only difference between their regular counterparts was the way terrain generated in them. As a result, most variant biomes were removed from the generator. In Java Edition, these biomes were merged with their normal variants, while in Bedrock Edition, these biomes still exist, but remain unused.

title: Birch Forest
summary: A birch forest is a lush temperate biome, usually generating near other lush biomes. There are two variants in the biome family.

title: Snowy Plains
summary: The snowy plains is a snow-covered grassland biome in the Overworld that usually generates near other snowy biomes.

title: Coarse Dirt
summary: Coarse dirt is a variation of dirt on which grass block cannot spread.

title: Badlands
summary: The badlands, formerly and commonly referred to as the mesa biome, are uncommon warm biomes, featuring mounds of terracotta, coming in various colors. There are three different variants of the badlands biome.

title: Commands/summon
summary: Summons an entity.

title: Savanna
summary: The savanna is a common warm biome. It typically generates bordering a desert, forest or plains biome, and has three variations total. It is a flat, low-elevation plain with scattered trees. Villages and pillager outposts may generate here.

title: Salmon
summary: Salmon are common passive aquatic mobs found in oceans and rivers. They are a reliable and nutritious source of early-game food when cooked.

title: Amplified
summary: Amplified, stylized in-game as AMPLIFIED, is a world type with a large range of altitude used in Overworld terrain generation.

title: Tropical Fish
summary: Tropical Fish are common passive mobs found in oceans, mangrove swamps and lush caves. There are 2,700 naturally occurring variants. Using commands, up to 3,104 visually distinct variants can be spawned.

title: Pufferfish
summary: Pufferfish are passive mobs found in oceans. They defend themselves by dealing damage and inflicting Poison to nearby players (if not in Peaceful difficulty‌) and certain mobs.

title: Cooked Salmon
summary: Cooked salmon is a food item obtained by cooking raw salmon.

title: Raw Salmon
summary: Raw salmon is a food item that can be eaten by the player or cooked to make cooked salmon.

title: Packed Ice
summary: Packed ice is an opaque solid block variant of ice. Unlike regular ice, it does not melt near bright  light sources.

title: Nether Wastes
summary:
See also: Hell
The Nether wastes is the most common biome found in the Nether.

title: Yggdrasil
summary: Yggdrasil is the name of the authentication system that is currently used for authenticating user credentials for Minecraft.

title: Old Growth Taiga
summary: Old growth taigas are cold forested biomes covered with tall spruce trees. There are two variants in the biome family.

title: Podzol
summary: Podzol is a dirt-type block that naturally blankets the surface of the old growth taiga and bamboo jungles, along with their respective variants. Grass blocks and mycelium cannot spread to this block.

title: Tommaso Checchi
summary: Tommaso Checchi (/ˈkɛkˌki/ KEHk-kee) is a former member of the Minecraft Redmond team.

title: Experience/Before 12w23a
summary: A chart which details the experience per level and cumulative experience more accurately is available here: Detailed Enchanting Experience Chart (last updated 7/3/12)

title: Jumping
summary: Jumping is a mechanic that elevates the player 1 1⁄4 block into the air. It also has other effects when combined with another forms of movement.

title: Game rule
summary: Game rules are a set of customizable options for a specific in-game world.

title: Horse Update
summary: The Horse Update is the name for Java Edition version 1.6.1 (or 1.6), a major update released on July 1, 2013.

title: Xbox One Edition
summary: Minecraft: Xbox One Edition is the Legacy Console Edition version of Minecraft developed by 4J Studios and Mojang Studios for the Xbox One.

title: Attribute
summary: Attributes are a system of buffs/debuffs that are properties on mobs and players. Attributes also have modifiers that adjust the strength of their effect.

title: Enchanted Golden Apple
summary: An enchanted golden apple (in Java Edition) or enchanted apple (in Bedrock Edition), is a rare, uncraftable variant of the golden apple that grants much more powerful effects when consumed.

title: Sand
summary:
Sand is a gravity-affected block found abundantly in deserts and beaches, and less commonly in or near surface water.
 Red sand is a variation of sand found exclusively in the badlands.

title: Cake
summary:
Cake is a food and a block that can be eaten by the player.
A cake with candle is a light-producing variation created when a candle is used on an uneaten cake.

title: Block of Coal
summary: A block of coal is a storage block, equivalent to nine coal, that can also be used as fuel.

title: Terracotta
summary: Terracotta is a block that comes in the sixteen dye colors (except with a brownish tint), as well as an undyed variant. It is found abundantly in badlands biomes, or can be obtained by smelting clay.

title: Name Tag
summary: A name tag is an item used to name mobs in the world and prevent them from despawning naturally.

title: Zombie Horse
summary: A zombie horse is an unused variant of the regular horse.

title: Taming
summary: Taming is a game mechanic that allows the player to domesticate and tame a wild mob.

title: Horse Saddle
summary: Horse saddles were items which allowed the player to ride horses.

title: Lead
summary: Leads are tools used to leash and lead passive and neutral animals, golems and some monsters.

title: Horse Armor
summary: Horse armor is a special type of armor that can be given to a horse to wear.

title: Carpet
summary: Carpets are thin variants of wool that can be dyed in any of the 16 colors.

title: Reserved6
summary: reserved6 is an unused former placeholder block.

title: Aleksandra Zając
summary: Aleksandra 'MissMarzenia' Zając is a project manager at Mojang Studios since September 2015. From April 2013 to September 2015, she was a customer support agent.

title: Entity format
summary: Entities are stored in the entities folder of respective dimension folders. It is stored like regional Minecraft Anvil files, which are named in the form r.x.z.mca.

title: Horse
summary: Horses are passive mobs that can be ridden when tamed and saddled.

title: Redstone components
summary: Redstone components are the blocks used to build redstone circuits.

title: Martin Odhelius
summary: Martin Odhelius is a former web developer working at Mojang Studios from January 2013 to March 2017.

title: Linn Hultman
summary: Linn Hultman is the former office manager of Mojang Studios. She was initially hired by Markus Persson to be his personal assistant. Her work ended with Mojang at the start of 2014.

title: Poi Poi Chen
summary: Poi Poi Chen is a former artist who worked for Mojang Studios, specializing in 2D design. She worked on artwork for Scrolls until the development of the title ceased in June of 2015. Since leaving Mojang, she has returned to school to pursue a career in either programming or bio-medicine.

title: Amir Moulavi
summary: Amir Moulavi is the former Minecraft Realms lead developer at Mojang Studios.

title: MCUpdate
summary: MCUpdate is a Tumblr blog that hosted Minecraft version changes and updates for the old launcher client.

title: Realms
summary: Minecraft Realms is an official subscription-based server hosting service that allows players to create and manage their own private Minecraft servers. Hosted by Mojang, Realms provides a simple way to create servers and allows the owner to manage them from inside the game, without knowledge of hosting on the internet. In Java Edition, Realms also allow players to choose from a list of minigames to play temporarily, as well as several pre-made world templates, adventure maps, experience maps, and inspiration maps, all made by Realms community map makers. Maps on Java Edition are updated by Mojang sporadically, ranging from a few days to as recently as one to two months. Realms are not intended for large public servers, but for groups of friends or as a family server.

title: Commands/help
summary: Provides help/lists of commands.

title: Hay Bale
summary: Hay bales are storage blocks equivalent to nine pieces of wheat. They are used as a crafting ingredient, to feed llamas, horses and horse variants, reduce fall damage or extend campfire smoke.

title: Mojam
summary: The Humble Bundle Mojam was an annual charity event in which the Mojang Studios team and other developers create a series of collections ("bundles") of video games that are sold and distributed online at a price determined by the purchaser. Sales of bundles are split between the developers/creators, the Humble Bundle operators, and one or more charities including Child's Play, the Electronic Frontier Foundation, charity: water, and the American Red Cross, with the buyer able to set the revenue split between these groups.

title: Stonecutter
summary: The stonecutter is used to craft stone and copper related blocks in smaller and more precise quantities than crafting, and is more efficient than crafting for certain recipes. It also serves as a stone mason's job site block.

title: Scoreboard
summary: The scoreboard system is a complex gameplay mechanic utilized through commands. Mainly intended for mapmakers and server operators, scoreboards are used to track, set, and list the scores of entities in a myriad of different ways.

title: Weapon
summary: Weapons are items that can be used to damage entities.

title: Dropper
summary: A dropper is a low-capacity storage block that can eject its contents into the world or into other containers when given a redstone signal.

title: Commands/testfor
summary: Counts entities (players, mobs, items, etc.) matching specified conditions.

title: Minecart with Hopper
summary: A minecart with hopper is a hopper inside a minecart. Unlike a normal hopper it pulls items from containers much more quickly, cannot push items into containers and can collect item entities through a single layer of solid blocks.

title: Activator Rail
summary: An activator rail is a type of rail that can "activate" certain minecarts.

title: Block of Quartz
summary: A block of quartz is a mineral block used for decoration. It can be turned into a chiseled quartz block, quartz pillar or quartz bricks.

title: Minecart with Monster Spawner
summary: Minecarts with monster spawners are a combination of both minecarts and monster spawner.

title: Minecart with TNT
summary: A minecart with TNT is a block of TNT inside a minecart. Unlike normal TNT it can detonate instantly under certain conditions and its damage and blast radius is increased by its speed when it detonates.

title: Easter eggs
summary: An Easter egg is an intentional hidden message, inside joke, or feature in a work such as a computer program, web page, video game, television program, movie, book, or crossword. Minecraft features several Easter eggs hidden in the game.

title: Daylight Detector
summary:
A daylight detector is a block that outputs a redstone signal based on sunlight.
Using it inverts it, causing it instead to output a redstone signal based on the darkness of the sky.

title: Info update
summary: info_update and info_update2 are debugging/placeholder blocks exclusive to Bedrock Edition that generated in place of blocks that are not yet added.

title: Hopper
summary: A hopper is a low-capacity storage block that can be used to collect item entities directly above it, as well as to transfer items into and out of other containers.

title: Trapped Chest
summary: A trapped chest functions as a normal chest for item storage, but it produces redstone power when opened. It can be visually distinguished from normal chests by a red coloration around the latch.

title: Nether Quartz
summary: Nether quartz is a white mineral found in the Nether.

title: Nether Quartz Ore
summary: Nether quartz ore is ore found in the Nether, and is a source of quartz.

title: Block of Redstone
summary: A block of redstone is a mineral block equivalent to nine redstone dust. It acts as a permanently powered redstone power source that can be pushed by pistons.

title: Options.txt
summary: options.txt is the file that stores all the options changeable in the in-game options menu and various other information the game needs to store after quitting. It is found in the .minecraft folder in Java Edition or in the com.mojang/minecraftpe folder in Bedrock Edition, and can be edited with any basic text editor to change options. Most settings can be changed in-game, but a few can be changed only by editing this file. The options.txt file for the latest version of the game is not backward-compatible with older versions of the game.

title: Emerald
summary: Emeralds are rare minerals that are used primarily as the currency for trading with villagers and wandering traders. Naturally-occurring emeralds are rarer than diamonds.

title: Herobrine/StreamFAQ
summary:
1  -  How did you decide to stage this hoax?

I came across the original Herobrine creepypasta on /v/ and immediately liked it.

title: Herobrine/StreamStory
summary: So like I touched on earlier I first streamed on EmasVidyaStream, but we left and started our own stream called "Brocraft".

title: Apple
summary: Apples are food items that can be eaten by the player.

title: Thorns
summary: Thorns is an armor enchantment that causes attackers to be damaged when they deal damage to the wearer.

title: Firework Star
summary: Firework stars are items used to determine the color, effect, and shape of firework rockets.

title: Enchanted Book
summary: An enchanted book is an item that lets players add enchantments to certain items using an anvil.

title: Server/Requirements/Dedicated
summary: It should be noted that these suggestion presume default settings in server.conf - i.e., a Draw Distance no higher than 10, and is also based on a new world; the bigger the world gets, especially if there's advanced redstone circuitry at work, the requirements - especially the RAM, or in the case of lots of redstone or mobs (in e.g. grinders), the CPU - increase significantly (to the point where a major world with several camps, redstone machinery, grinders, etcetera can easily more than double the requirements).

title: Server/Requirements/Server
summary:
Since Minecraft rarely uses more than one thread, consider possible waste when buying more than 2 cores. However this does not apply to mods and plugins which utilize their own threads - buy accordingly. Assume that most of the server's load will be on a single core. The main performance factor is without a doubt CPU clock speed. CPU cache sizes and RAM latency are also factors. There does not appear to be a disadvantage to using high-end desktop processors.(verify?)
It should be noted that these suggestion presume default settings in server.conf - i.e., a Draw Distance no higher than 10, and is also based on a new world; the bigger the world gets, especially if there's advanced redstone circuitry at work, the requirements - especially the RAM, or in the case of lots of redstone or mobs (in e.g. grinders), the CPU - increase significantly (to the point where a major world with several camps, redstone machinery, grinders, etcetera can easily more than double the requirements).

title: Server/Requirements
summary: This page lists the server requirements of the current Java Edition version, 1.19.3.

title: Firework Rocket
summary: A firework rocket is an item (and entity) used for creating decorative explosions, boosting when flying with elytra, and loading into a crossbow as ammunition.

title: Vu Bui
summary:
Vu Bui is the Chief Content Officer of Mojang Studios and has been since October 2012.
He is of Vietnamese descent.

title: Windswept Hills
summary: Windswept hills are uncommon cold biomes that mainly generate in hilly terrain. There are three variants in the biome family.‌

title: Dimension
summary: Dimensions are accessible realms within a Minecraft world characterized by a way of generation, biomes and structures, and other things unique to one dimension.

title: Redstone Comparator
summary: A redstone comparator is a redstone component used to maintain, compare, or subtract signal strength, or to measure certain block states (primarily the fullness of containers).

title: Pi Edition
summary: Minecraft: Pi Edition is an edition of Minecraft developed for the Raspberry Pi.

title: Redstone Update
summary: The Redstone Update is the name for Java Edition version 1.5, a major update released on Wednesday, March 13, 2013.

title: Nether Reactor Core
summary: The nether reactor core is an unused block that cannot be obtained with the use of commands.

title: Glowing Obsidian
summary: Glowing obsidian is an unobtainable decorative block that emits light.

title: Nether reactor
summary: The nether reactor was a player-built structure exclusive to Bedrock Edition which, when activated, a massive structure of netherrack spawned large quantities of normally rare or unobtainable items.

title: Invisibility
summary: Invisibility is a status effect that turns entities invisible. It has one potency level (active), but its duration can be extended.

title: Anvil mechanics/Before 1.8
summary: This page explains the mechanics of the anvil.

title: Anvil
summary: An anvil is a block that allows players to repair items, rename items, and combine enchantments.

title: Jonatan Pöljö
summary: Jonatan 'eldrone' Pöljö is a former 3D artist at Mojang, who previously assisted with the development of 0x10c until its indefinite shelving.

title: Mushroom Fields
summary: Mushroom fields, commonly referred to as mushroom islands, are rare biomes which always generate as islands surrounded by deep oceans. They are the only place in the game where mycelium and mooshrooms are found, and have the special property that no hostile mobs normally spawn in these biomes.

title: Swamp hut
summary: Swamp huts (also known as witch huts) are small generated structures that have the ability to spawn witches and black cats.

title: Teleportation
summary: Teleportation is a form of transportation in which the moving object is instantaneously moved to its target location.

title: Bat
summary: A bat is a flying ambient passive mob that spawns in dark areas underground.

title: Resource pack
summary: The resource pack system provides a way for players to customize textures, models, music, sounds, languages, texts such as the end poem, splashes, credits, and fonts without any code modification.

title: Witch
summary: A witch is a hostile mob that uses harmful splash potions as ranged weapons and positive potions on itself.

title: Lava Spawner
summary: The lava spawner was a block that would repeatedly create lava on each of its four orthogonal sides.

title: Carrot
summary:
A carrot is a food item obtained from carrot crops that can be used to plant them, eaten or used as a crafting ingredient.
Carrot crops are planted in farmland and used to grow carrots.

title: Nikolaj Nyholm
summary: Nikolaj Nyholm is a Danish entrepreneur with a specialization in internet start-up companies, who has served as a contracting advisor for Mojang Studios since February 2011.

title: Pumpkin Pie
summary: Pumpkin pie is a food item that can be eaten by the player.

title: Punch
summary: Punch is an enchantment for a bow that increases an arrow's knockback, much like the Knockback enchantment for melee weapons. This does not increase the damage of the bow.

title: Infinity
summary: Infinity is an enchantment to bows that prevents regular arrows from being consumed when shot. One arrow is needed to use a bow enchanted with Infinity.

title: Flame
summary: Flame is an enchantment that causes bows to shoot flaming arrows.

title: Power
summary: Power is a bow enchantment which increases arrow damage.

title: Wither Skeleton
summary: Wither skeletons are tall black variants of skeletons equipped with stone swords that inflict the poison-like Wither effect. They are found exclusively in nether fortresses and are the only source of wither skeleton skulls.

title: Nether Star
summary: The nether star is a rare item dropped by the wither that is used solely to craft beacons.

title: Pretty Scary Update
summary: The Pretty Scary Update is the name for Java Edition version 1.4.2, a major update officially released on Thursday, October 25, 2012.

title: Carrot on a Stick
summary: A carrot on a stick is an item that can be used to control saddled pigs.

title: Head
summary: A head is a block. There are six‌/seven‌ types of heads: player (Steve's head by default), zombie, skeleton, wither skeleton, creeper, piglin‌, and dragon.

title: Dragon Egg
summary: The dragon egg is a decorative block or a "trophy item", and is the rarest item obtainable in the game, as it generates once (or twice in Bedrock Edition).

title: Potato
summary:
A potato is a food item obtained from potato crops that can be used to plant them, consumed raw or cooked to make baked potatoes.
Potato crops are planted in farmland and used to grow potatoes and, rarely, poisonous potatoes.

title: Poisonous Potato
summary: A poisonous potato is a type of potato that can poison the player.

title: Golden Carrot
summary: A golden carrot is a valuable food item and brewing ingredient. It provides the second most saturation in the game, behind suspicious stew crafted with either a dandelion or blue orchid.

title: Baked Potato
summary: A baked potato is a food item that can be eaten by the player.

title: Wither
summary: The wither is a player-constructed undead hostile boss mob that floats and shoots explosive skulls at players and mobs. It is the only source of nether stars, which are used to craft beacons.

title: Lectern
summary: A lectern is a block used to hold written books for multiple players to read in multiplayer. It also serves as a librarian's job site block.

title: Wall
summary: A wall is a decorative block. Like fences, they can be used to create boundaries, because players and most mobs cannot climb or jump over them.

title: Flower Pot
summary: A flower pot is a decorative block that can contain flowers, bamboo, saplings, cacti, mushrooms, fungi, and other reasonably small plants.

title: Item Frame
summary:
An item frame is an entity‌ or block entity‌ that displays the item or block that is inside it.
A glow item frame keeps itself and the item inside it illuminated, even in the dark.

title: Owen Jones
summary: Owen Jones, formerly known as Owen Hill, is the Director of Creative Communications at Mojang Studios. Before joining Mojang, Jones worked as the web editor for PC Gamer, where he gained a reputation for producing high-quality work at an equally high quantity, gaining the attention of Markus Persson, who became determined to hire him. In August 2012, it was announced that Jones would be bidding farewell to PC Gamer and would be moving to Stockholm, Sweden the following September to work with Mojang.

title: Villages.dat format
summary: The villages.dat file located in the data folder of every Minecraft level is used to store information about the villages in the level.

title: Zombie Villager
summary: A zombie villager is a variant of the zombie that can be cured into a normal villager using a golden apple while it is under the effect of Weakness.

title: Command Block
summary: A command block is a block that can execute commands.

title: Beacon
summary: A beacon is a block that projects a light beam skyward and can provide status effects such as Speed, Jump Boost, Haste, Regeneration, Resistance, or Strength to nearby players.

title: Invisible Bedrock
summary: Invisible bedrock is an invisible block used to create a world boundary around Old worlds.

title: Servers.dat format
summary: The servers.dat  is used to store information regarding the multiplayer servers that the player has added to their server list.

title: Skin pack
summary: Skin packs add additional skins that players may choose from along with the default skins included with the game's purchase. Skin packs are available in Bedrock Edition as purchasable content. They often feature characters from other video games, movies, and television shows, alongside original designs. Skin packs all have skins related to one another, e.g, a movie skin pack includes characters from only the designated movie. Skin packs are a way to quickly obtain several themed skins at once.

title: Add-on
summary: Add-ons are the first step toward bringing customization to all editions of Minecraft and are officially supported by Mojang/Minecraft.

title: Minecraft Indev
summary: Minecraft Indev refers to 10 versions of Indev released from February 6 to February 23, 2010.

title: Andrea Jörgensen
summary: Andrea 'Hideous' Jörgensen is a Swedish developer. Jörgensen was working on customer support before she left Mojang.

title: Paul Spooner
summary: Paul Spooner is a 3D artist notable for his contributions to the global environmental elements of Minecraft, specifically the iconic large trees. After being disappointed with his inability to build a tree fort in the small trees, he wrote a map modding tool which was then partially included in the base game. Unlike Daniel Rosenfeld, Spooner's in game character does not have a Mojang cape. Spooner has a deviantART account, and a YouTube channel.

title: Minecraft Infdev
summary: Minecraft Infdev refers to all 26 versions of Infdev, released from February 27, 2010, to June 30, 2010, as well as one version of Alpha released on June 30, 2010.

title: Timeline of events
summary: This page's purpose is to retrace the history of all events related to Minecraft and Mojang Studios in a less targeted manner than the different version history pages.

title: 57Digital
summary: 57Digital is a mobile application development company based in Sheffield, England.

title: Måns Olson
summary: Måns Olson is a game developer at Mojang Studios, currently working on the launcher for Minecraft and developing Minecraft Dungeons. Previously, he worked as the lead designer for Caller’s Bane.

title: NBT format
summary: The Named Binary Tag (NBT) is a tree data structure used by Minecraft in many save files to store arbitrary data. The format is comprised of a handful of tags. Tags have a numeric ID, a name, and a payload. A user-accessible version in the form of strings is the stringified Named Binary Tag (SNBT) format.

title: Village mechanics
summary: This page describes mechanics relating to villages and villagers.

title: Obsidian platform
summary: The obsidian platform is a 5×1×5 square of obsidian that generates when an entity enters the End through an end portal.

title: Jungle pyramid
summary: Jungle pyramids‌ or jungle temples‌ are structures found in jungles.

title: String
summary: String is an item used in crafting recipes such as bows, fishing rods and leads. When placed as a block, string becomes tripwire, which can be combined with tripwire hooks to form a tripwire circuit.

title: Tripwire Hook
summary: A tripwire hook is a block that can be used to detect entities (players, mobs, items, etc.) when part of a tripwire circuit is passed through.

title: Block of Emerald
summary: A block of emerald is a precious mineral block equivalent to nine emeralds.

title: Enchanting mechanics
summary: This article is about the mechanics of enchanting.

title: Desert pyramid
summary: A desert pyramid, often referred to as a desert temple, is a sandstone structure that generates in deserts. It contains 4 chests under the floor in the center protected by a TNT trap.

title: Emerald Ore
summary: Emerald ore is a rare mineral block that generates only in mountains, frozen peaks and windswept hills biomes.

title: Ender Chest
summary: Ender chests are a type of chest whose contents are exclusive to each player, and can be accessed from anywhere in the world.

title: Demo mode
summary: The demo mode is a demo version of Minecraft for users who have not purchased the game yet and would like to try it out first without purchasing it.

title: Trading
summary: The trading system is a gameplay mechanic that allows players to trade principally emeralds for items (and vice-versa) with villagers, as well as wandering traders.

title: Speed
summary: Speed is a status effect that increases an entity's walking speed by 20% multiplied by the effect level.  It expands a player's field of view (FOV) accordingly.  Negative levels decrease speed.

title: Johan Bernhardsson
summary: Johan Bernhardsson is a former game developer at Mojang Studios, who worked extensively on Minecraft: Pocket Edition, and over a year by himself.

title: Large Biomes
summary: Large Biomes is a world type that generates Overworld worlds at a higher scale than in normal worlds. It does not affect Nether biomes at all.

title: Splitscreen
summary: Splitscreen is a console-exclusive feature that allows up to four players to play on one screen at the same time.

title: The Void
summary: The Void is an empty biome that generates only a 33×33 void start platform centered on a block of cobblestone at coordinates 8, 3, 8.

title: Written Book
summary: A written book is an item created after a book and quill is signed. It appears the same as a regular book, but without the quill, and has an enchanted-looking glint.

title: Book and Quill
summary: A book and quill is an item used to write written books.

title: Joe Liu
summary: Joe 'Noirceuil' Liu is a former customer support agent for Mojang who had previously worked with Marc Watson and Mike Till at a previous job.

title: 0x10c
summary: 0x10c was a space sandbox game that was being developed by Markus "Notch" Persson and Mojang AB during 2012 and 2013 as a followup to Minecraft.

title: World selection menu
summary: The world selection menu is one of the game's multiple menu screens, which allows access to the Create New World menu, and equally importantly listing preexisting worlds which can be entered.

title: Minicraft
summary: Minicraft is a 2D top-down action game made by Markus "Notch" Persson, for the 2011 48-hour game programming contest Ludum Dare 22.

title: Chain
summary: Chains are metallic decoration blocks.

title: Enchanting/Levels
summary: The minimum values are all calculated using a linear function y = kx+m	where y is the calculated minimum value, x is the current enchantment power level and k and m varies between different enchantments.

title: Main menu
summary: The main menu is one of Minecraft's several menu screens.

title: Patrick Geuder
summary: Karl Patrick Geuder is a Mojang Studios employee who performs large-scale data analysis.

title: Mathias Andersson
summary: Mathias Andersson is a member of the brand enforcement team.

title: Anton Albiin
summary: Anton Albiin is a former member of the Mojang Studios customer support team. He left the company in March 2013.

title: Mike Till
summary: Mike Till is a former Mojang Studios customer support agent who worked with Marc Watson at their previous customer service job. When it became clear that more support staff would be needed, Marc requested that Mike be brought on. Mike is a gamer, and formerly of the US Army.

title: Karin Severinson
summary: Karin Severinson handles finances for Mojang.

title: Boat
summary: A boat is a drivable vehicle entity used primarily for fast transport of players and passenger mobs over bodies of water. Bamboo rafts‌ look different, but function nearly identically to other boats.

title: Healing
summary: Healing is the mechanic of regaining lost health.

title: Flying
summary: Flying is the most versatile form of transportation and is available in Creative and Spectator mode.

title: Kristoffer Jelbring
summary: Kristoffer Jelbring is a former game developer at Mojang Studios, working on Minecraft Dungeons. Prior to 2018, he was also a web developer. In December 2020, he left Mojang Studios.

title: Erik Broes
summary: Erik 'Grum' Broes is a game developer at Mojang Studios.

title: Dispenser
summary: A dispenser is a low-capacity storage block that can fire projectiles, use certain items or tools or place certain blocks, fluids or entities when given a redstone signal. Items that do not have unique dispenser functions are instead ejected into the world.

title: Demo
summary: Official Minecraft demo releases available to try for free include:

title: Warren Loo
summary: Warren 'EvilSeph' Loo is a game developer who formerly worked for Mojang Studios.

title: LEGO Minecraft
summary: LEGO Minecraft is a licensed LEGO theme of sets based on Minecraft.

title: End spike
summary: End spikes, also known as obsidian spikes, obsidian pillars, obsidian towers, and end pillars are a feature in The End biome that are made of obsidian.

title: Nathan Adams
summary: Nathan 'Dinnerbone' Adams is a technical director at Mojang Studios who worked on Java and Bedrock editions, and its launcher.

title: Drops
summary: Drops are items that appear when mobs and some other entities die or when most kinds of blocks are broken.

title: Plains
summary: Plains are temperate grasslands biomes. They are among the first biomes added to the game. There are two plains biome variants in the biome family. They are the second most common biome, with Forest being slightly more common.

title: Nathan Gilbert
summary: Nathan 'Tahg' Gilbert is a programmer who previously worked on the official Modding API for Mojang.

title: Tundra
summary: A tundra was a snow-covered biome and the precursor of the current snowy plains, but with fewer trees and no tall grass, tundras existed in the game prior to the Adventure Update (Beta 1.8 for Java Edition) or in versions before Alpha 0.9.0 for  Pocket Edition.

title: Forest
summary: Forests are temperate biomes. There are a total of two variants in the biome family. They are the most common biome in Minecraft, being only slightly more common than plains.

title: Beach
summary: Beaches are common coastal biomes that serve as transition biomes from the mainland to an ocean. There are three variants of beach biome.

title: Iron Golem
summary: An iron golem is a large, powerful neutral utility mob that defends players and villagers. It is one of the few mobs that can be built then spawned in the game.

title: Item (entity)
summary: Items are "dropped" blocks or items (non-block resources) that appear in the world, rather than being in the inventory of a player or block entity; they are a type of entity.

title: Anvil file format
summary: Anvil is a file storage format. It brings a list of changes and improvements over from the previous file format, Region. It was implemented in snapshot 12w07a for release in Java Edition 1.2.1.

title: Zombie siege
summary: Zombie sieges are in-game events where many zombies spawn in and attack a village.

title: Marc Watson
summary: Marc Watson is an associate producer at Mojang Studios, working with the New Games team. Prior to June 2020, Marc worked as a content manager. Before January 2016, he also worked as a customer support agent, rising to become a customer support administrator.

title: Saturation
summary: Saturation is an instant status effect that reduces the need for eating. It also prevents death by hunger if the player has no food.

title: Desert Well
summary: Desert wells are features consisting of sandstone.

title: Fire Charge
summary: Fire charges are items that can be used as a single-use version of a flint and steel or shot as a small fireball from a dispenser.

title: Bottle o' Enchanting
summary: A bottle o' enchanting is a throwable item that releases experience orbs on impact.

title: Ocelot
summary: Ocelots are rare passive mobs found in jungles.

title: Jungle tree
summary: Jungle trees are generated structures native to the jungle biome. Jungle trees range from short bushes to tall trees that reach up to 31 blocks in height. Their wood is of a pale brownish color.

title: Jon Kågström
summary: Jon Kågström is the former AI programmer for Minecraft. He was hired for Mojang Studios on 28 December 2011, having previously worked on AI for Battlefield. He helped Mojang create new "smart" AI for the mobs in Minecraft. He played an active role alongside Jeb in developing Minecraft features, fixes, and improvements for Java Edition 1.2.1. After this, he left Minecraft development to work on Scrolls. Since the development of Scrolls was discontinued, it is unknown if he will ever work on Minecraft again.

title: Jungle
summary: A jungle is a temperate biome full of dense vegetation which generate in areas with high humidity values, often next to forests. There are three varieties of jungles.

title: Spruce
summary: A spruce and pine, grows from a spruce sapling and has growth patterns and requirements similar to birch trees, although they appear different. They are mainly found in the taiga biome, but they may also generate in windswept forest, snowy plains, snowy taiga, and old growth taiga biomes.

title: Oak
summary: An oak is the most common tree in the game, found in a variety of biomes, available in several variants. It has the smallest initial space requirement for growth, and along with dark oak trees, it has a chance to drop an apple when a leaf block is destroyed. As with birches, an oak tree grown near flowers can generate with a bee nest attached.

title: World type
summary: World type is an option to change how worlds generate in Minecraft.

title: Superflat
summary: Superflat JE or Flat BE is a world type or a vanilla world preset replacing the normal varied terrain of the Overworld, with customizable layers.

title: Heads-up display
summary: The heads-up display (HUD) appears on screen while the player is in the game. It is superimposed on their view of the game world.

title: Water
summary: Water is a fluid that naturally generates abundantly in the Overworld.

title: Key codes
summary: This is a list of key codes used by Minecraft, which are used in configuration files such as the options.txt file in the Minecraft directory.

title: Water Spawner
summary: The water spawner was a block that would repeatedly create water on each of its four orthogonal sides.

title: Spawn/Multiplayer details
summary: For this discussion, coordinates refer to the column centered at (x+0.5, z+0.5).

title: Language
summary: Languages is a feature that allows changing languages for people who prefer to play in a language other than their default setting. The language menu is accessible via a button in the options/settings menu below general.

title: Spawn Egg
summary: A spawn egg is an item used to spawn mobs directly.

title: Hayden Scott-Baron
summary: Hayden 'Dock' Scott-Baron was the first person to join Mojang (then still called Mojang Specifications) as the artist of Minecraft.

title: Particles
summary: Particles are special graphical effects in Minecraft that are created when certain events occur, such as explosions, rainfall, or smelting items in a furnace.

title: Textures
summary: Textures in Minecraft are images applied to blocks, items, entities, particles, weather effects and GUI that allow players to recognize it. In Java Edition default textures are located in assets\minecraft\textures in client.jar, while in Bedrock and Education editions they are in data\vanilla and data\vanilla_<game version>.

title: Fortune
summary: Fortune is an enchantment applied to mining and digging tools that increases the number and/or chances of specific item drops. It does not increase experience drops.

title: Unbreaking
summary: Unbreaking is an enchantment that gives a chance for an item to avoid durability reduction when it is used, effectively increasing the item's durability.

title: Efficiency
summary: Efficiency is an enchantment that increases the player's mining speed.

title: Silk Touch
summary: Silk Touch is a tool enchantment that causes certain blocks to drop themselves as items instead of their usual drops when mined.

title: Looting
summary: Looting is an enchantment for swords that can cause mobs to drop more items and increase the chances of rare drops. The additional drops do not affect experience.

title: Fire Aspect
summary: Fire Aspect is a sword enchantment that sets the target on fire.

title: Knockback
summary: Knockback is an enchantment to a sword that increases the sword's knockback.

title: Bane of Arthropods
summary: Bane of Arthropods is a weapon enchantment that increases damage to arthropod mobs (spiders, cave spiders, bees, silverfish, and endermites).

title: Respiration
summary: Respiration is a helmet enchantment for extending breathing time underwater. It can be applied to other armor pieces using commands.

title: Smite
summary: Smite is an enchantment applied to a sword or axe, increasing the damage dealt to undead mobs.

title: Sharpness
summary: Sharpness is an enchantment applied to a sword or axe that increases melee damage.

title: Aqua Affinity
summary: Aqua Affinity is a helmet enchantment that increases underwater mining speed.

title: Feather Falling
summary: Feather Falling is an enchantment unique to boots that reduces fall damage the user takes.  It does not affect falling speed.

title: Blast Protection
summary: Blast Protection is an armor enchantment that reduces damage taken from explosions and fireworks.

title: Projectile Protection
summary: Projectile Protection is an armor enchantment that reduces damage taken from projectiles.

title: Protection
summary: Protection is an enchantment applied to armor that adds bonus damage reduction.

title: Fire Protection
summary: Fire Protection is an armor enchantment that reduces damage taken from sources of fire.

title: Graphics setting
summary:
Graphics is one of the game's many visual settings which allows for the game's rendering of an assortment of features to be adjusted to match computer specifications.
There are currently three different options for graphics to be set to, in order of computing expense: Fast, Fancy and Fabulous!, each bringing their own dedicated visual improvements.

title: End Poem
summary: The End Poem is a freehand poem written by musician Julian Gough that appears when the player uses the exit portal, before the credits. It has been in the public domain, under the CC0 1.0 Universal (CC0 1.0) Public Domain Dedication, since 2022.

title: End Crystal
summary: An end crystal is an entity that can be crafted or found on the End's main island, where it heals the ender dragon. It can only be placed on obsidian or bedrock and explodes instantly when attacked or damaged in most ways.

title: 4J Studios
summary: 4J Studios which stands for Jute, Jam, Journalism (the 3J's of Dundee), and  Joysticks, is an independent game development studio based in Scotland, with offices in Dundee and East Linton. The staff includes many former key personnel from defunct studio VIS Entertainment. It was founded by Paddy Burns and Chris van der Kuyl. They are best known for developing Minecraft for the Xbox 360, Xbox One, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, PlayStation Vita, Wii U, and Nintendo Switch.

title: Nether Brick
summary: A nether brick is an item made by smelting netherrack in a furnace.

title: Biome/Before Beta 1.8
summary: In Java Edition Beta 1.8, Legacy Console Edition TU5, and Pocket Edition v0.9.0 alpha, biomes received a major overhaul, removing and changing many biomes.

title: Third-person view
summary: Third person view allows the player to view the nearby environment from an "outside" perspective.

title: Death messages
summary: Death messages are messages sent in the chat to either all players or a specific player to announce the death of a player or pet.

title: Instant Health
summary: Instant Health is an instant status effect that increases health for living mobs and damages the undead.

title: Seamless Stone Slab
summary: Seamless stone slab refers to several unused variants of the slab block with metadata exceeding what was actually used at the time. They can be considered a precursor to smooth stone.

title: Ocean
summary: The ocean is an aquatic biome consisting of water. Oceans are the largest biome by area, covering anywhere around 25-33% of the surface area of the Overworld when factoring in all of its varieties and consist of a deep water source with the surface at an altitude of y=63 by default, which is counted as the "sea level" layer of the world.

title: Splash Potion
summary: Splash potions are a variant of potions that can be thrown.

title: Glistering Melon Slice
summary: A glistering melon slice is an inedible item used for brewing potions of Healing. It is also one of the many potion ingredients that can be used to make mundane potions.

title: Brewing
summary: Brewing is the process of creating potions, splash potions, and lingering potions by adding various ingredients to water bottles in a brewing stand. In Education Edition, brewing can also create medicines.

title: Far Lands
summary: The Far Lands is a terrain generation bug that appears when the noise generators responsible for creating the shape of terrain stop functioning properly.

title: Bedrock Edition
summary: Minecraft: Bedrock Edition (officially just Minecraft) refers to the multi-platform versions of Minecraft developed by Mojang Studios, Xbox Game Studios, and SkyBox Labs and based on the Bedrock codebase.

title: Non-renewable resource
summary: A non-renewable resource (as opposed to a renewable resource) is a resource that cannot be obtained in indefinite quantities in Survival without exploring more terrain or using certain glitches, commands or Creative mode to create more of them. While running out of resources other than the unique dragon egg is not likely to be a factor in normal gameplay due to massive size of a Minecraft map, in principle there is a finite quantity of these resources available in each Minecraft world.

title: End Stone
summary: End stone is a block that appears in the End and, apart from generated structures, makes up all of the solid ground that exists in that dimension.

title: Leonard Gram
summary: Leonard 'Xlson' Gram, formerly known as Leonard Axelsson, is a former employee at Mojang Studios. He worked with backend development. On December 21, 2017 he announced that he was leaving Mojang.

title: The End
summary: The End is a dark, space-like dimension consisting of separate islands in the void made out of end stone. It is inhabited by endermen and shulkers. The ender dragon also spawns when the player first arrives.

title: Enchanting
summary: Enchanting is a mechanic that augments armor, tools, weapons, and books with one or more of a variety of "enchantments" that improve an item's existing abilities or imbue them with additional abilities and uses. A special "glint" animation appears on items that are enchanted.

title: End portal
summary: An end portal is a naturally occurring generated structure that is used to travel into the End. It can only be found in the portal room of a stronghold.

title: End Portal Frame
summary: An end portal frame is a block that resembles end stone with a decorative bluish-green top, with sides decorated in hollow rounded rectangles with the same color as the top.

title: Eye of Ender
summary: An eye of ender is a craftable item used to locate strongholds and activate the end portals within them.

title: NPC
summary: Non player characters (abbreviated as NPCs) are both passive and interactive mobs that have model similar to villagers. They are exclusive to Minecraft Education and Bedrock Edition.

title: Enchanting Table
summary: An enchanting table is a block that allows players to spend their experience point levels to enchant tools, weapons, books, armor, and certain other items.

title: Brewing Stand
summary: A brewing stand is a block used for brewing potions using bottles and suitable ingredients. It also serves as a cleric's job site block.

title: Cauldron
summary: A cauldron is a block that can contain water, lava or powder snow and, in certain situations, collect it from the environment. In Bedrock Edition, it can also hold potions or dyed water. It also serves as a leatherworker's job site block.

title: Item repair
summary: Item repair is a feature that allows players to repair damaged tools, armor, or other items with durability by combining them in the crafting grid or a grindstone.

title: Infested Block
summary: Infested blocks are blocks disguised as stone, cobblestone, deepslate, or any stone bricks variants, but spawn silverfish when broken in Survival or Adventure mode.

title: Fermented Spider Eye
summary: A fermented spider eye is a brewing ingredient.

title: Magma Cream
summary: Magma cream is an item used in brewing to create potions of Fire Resistance, and to manually craft magma blocks.

title: Glass Bottle
summary: A glass bottle is an item that can hold water, potions, honey, or dragon's breath.

title: Blaze Powder
summary: Blaze powder is an item made from a blaze rod, which is dropped by a blaze when killed. Its main uses are to fuel brewing stands, to brew strength potions, and to make eyes of ender to take the player to the End.

title: Spider Eye
summary: A spider eye is a poisonous food and brewing item.

title: Breeding
summary: Breeding is a game mechanic that allows mobs of the same species to breed with each other to produce offspring (with the exception of breeding a mule, which requires a horse and donkey).

title: Hardcore
summary: Hardcore is a Java Edition exclusive variant of Survival and one of the main game modes in Minecraft. In this mode, the world is locked to Hard difficulty and the player cannot respawn after dying.

title: Mycelium
summary: Mycelium is a particularly rare variant of dirt that is found naturally only in mushroom fields biomes. It has a particle effect that resembles tiny spores being released constantly from the surface.

title: Lily Pad
summary: A lily pad is a short, flat non-solid block that can be found naturally growing only on water, in swamps and wheat farm rooms in woodland mansions.

title: Magma Cube
summary: A magma cube is a hostile mob found in the Nether. A magma cube behaves similarly to a slime, but is fireproof, jumps higher and deals more damage.

title: Villager
summary: Villagers are passive mobs that inhabit villages, work at their professions, breed, and interact with each other. Their outfit varies according to their occupation and biome. A player can trade with them using emeralds as currency.

title: Blaze
summary: Blazes are floating hostile mobs found in nether fortresses, and are the only source of blaze rods. They will attack through an occasional fireball trio attack.

title: Gold Nugget
summary: Gold nuggets are items used to make gold ingots and other various golden items. One gold nugget is effectively worth one-ninth of a gold ingot.

title: Nether Wart
summary:
Nether wart is a fungus harvested from nether wart crops and is used to plant them, as well as being vital in the creation of potions.
Nether wart crops are found in nether fortresses and bastions and is used to grow nether wart in soul sand.

title: Blaze Rod
summary: Blaze rods are items exclusively obtained from blazes. They act as an essential ingredient in brewing, as a fuel for both brewing and smelting, and for crafting the eye of ender that leads the player to the End.

title: Ghast Tear
summary: Ghast tears are items dropped by ghasts. They can be used to make potions of Regeneration and end crystals.

title: Snow Golem
summary: A snow golem is a player-constructed passive utility mob that is affected by temperature and whose utilities include defense against monsters and, in some biomes, snow farming.

title: Lydia Winters
summary: Lydia Winters is Mojang Studios' Chief Storyteller. Prior to 2020, she was known as the brand director, and before that as the director of fun. She is best known for being a part of MINECON livestreams, where she generally welcomes people to the event, and is also a special advisor at Block by Block, a charity dedicated to using Minecraft to improve public spaces worldwide. She is generally known as the first woman to have been hired by Mojang.

title: Nether Fortress
summary: A nether fortress is a large structure found in the Nether, consisting of bridges, corridors and towers. Nether fortressess are the only place where wither skeletons and blazes spawn, the latter of which's blaze rods being required to craft and fuel brewing stands and craft eyes of ender to access the End. It also features nether wart as loot, which is a key ingredient in brewing.

title: Farming
summary: Farming refers to the systematic production of renewable resources. The technique is typically used to get blocks, food, experience and other desired items. Specific types of farming are listed below.

title: Mooshroom
summary: Mooshrooms are mushroom-covered variants of cows exclusive to the rare mushroom fields biome.

title: Nether Bricks
summary:
Nether bricks  are blocks used to form nether fortresses in the Nether.
Red nether bricks, cracked nether bricks and chiseled nether bricks are decorative variants that do not naturally generate.

title: Poison
summary: Poison is an effect that inflicts damage over time, reducing the player's health to 1 (), but cannot kill.

title: Effect
summary: An effect is a helpful or harmful condition that affects an entity.

title: Hunger (effect)
summary: Hunger is a status effect which causes the hunger bar to deplete faster than normal.

title: Terrain features
summary: This page lists generated terrain features that are created in a Minecraft world.

title: Sprinting
summary: Sprinting is a method of transportation that allows the player to move faster, at the expense of depleting saturation. While sprinting, the player's field of view expands slightly while increasing the player's reach by .5-1 block. Players also inflict more knockback on the first hit when sprinting.

title: Blocking
summary: Blocking is a gameplay mechanic that allows players to block several forms of damage.

title: Ender Pearl
summary: An ender pearl is an item that can be thrown to teleport to where it lands, or used to craft eyes of ender which are required to access the End.

title: Swamp
summary: A swamp is a temperate biome where swamp huts containing witches and black cats generate, slimes and frogs can spawn. The main biome is forested with oak trees covered with vines, dead bushes, mushrooms and blue orchids.

title: Wheat Seeds
summary:
Wheat seeds (in Java Edition) or seeds (in Bedrock Edition) are items obtained by breaking grass, or more abundantly harvested from wheat crops, and are used to plant them.
Wheat crops are planted in farmland and used to grow wheat and wheat seeds.

title: Furnace
summary: A furnace is a utility block used for the smelting of blocks and items.

title: Cave Spider
summary: Cave spiders are small variants of the spider that inflict Poison with their attacks. They are exclusively spawned by monster spawners found in mineshafts.

title: Pumpkin Seeds
summary:
Pumpkin seeds are items obtained from pumpkins that can be used to grow pumpkin stems.
Pumpkin stems are plants grown on farmland that, over time, grow pumpkins on dirt, mud and moss blocks adjacent to them.

title: Melon Seeds
summary:
Melon seeds are items obtained from melon slices that can be used to grow melon stems.
Melon stems are plants grown on farmland that, over time, grow melons on dirt, mud and moss blocks adjacent to them.

title: Melon Slice
summary: A melon slice is a food item that can be eaten by the player.

title: Mineshaft
summary: Mineshafts are generated structures found primarily in caves.

title: Vines
summary: Vines are climbable non-solid vegetation blocks that grow on walls.

title: Rotten Flesh
summary: Rotten flesh is a food item that can be eaten by the player, at the high risk of inflicting Hunger.

title: Experience
summary: Experience (EXP or XP for short) can be obtained by gathering experience orbs from mining, defeating mobs, breeding, trading, fishing, completing advancements,‌ and using grindstones and furnaces. Experience gained during a player's life affects the player's score on the death screen. While having no direct effect on the player character, it can be used to enhance their equipment through enchanting, or by using an anvil to repair, rename, or combine enchantments on equipment. Experience also recovers durability on items with Mending that are being worn or are in-hand.

title: .minecraft
summary: .minecraft (or simply minecraft in macOS) is the folder Minecraft: Java Edition creates to run from. This folder includes the .jar files, sound, music, resource packs, personal options, worlds, etc.

title: River
summary: A river is a common biome. Rivers can serve as borders between various other biomes, and usually lead to oceans, although they can also form loops.

title: Camera
summary: The camera is an entity that is capable of capturing and storing images. In Education Edition, it works together with the portfolio item to create collections of photos.

title: Raw Beef
summary: Raw beef is a food item that can be eaten by the player or cooked in a furnace, smoker, or campfire to make steak.

title: Henrik Pettersson
summary: Henrik Pettersson is the third artist hired to work on Caller’s Bane, and was hired in August 2011.

title: Mountains
summary: Mountains refer to six somewhat rare cold, snowy, and temperate biomes.

title: Nautilus Shell
summary: A nautilus shell is an item that is used for crafting conduits.

title: Enderman
summary: An enderman is a tall neutral mob found in all three dimensions. Endermen normally ignore players but run to attack those that damage it or look directly at its face. Endermen teleport to avoid water (which harms them), sunlight, projectiles and some other damage sources, and they occasionally pick up certain blocks.

title: Server list
summary: Minecraft includes an in-game server list for multiplayer in which users can save the servers they visit.

title: Legacy Console Edition
summary: Legacy Console Edition is a discontinued term that refers collectively to several nearly identical editions of Minecraft developed by 4J Studios for game consoles.

title: Steak
summary: Steak (in Java Edition) or cooked beef (in Bedrock Edition) is a food item obtained from cows, mooshrooms, or from cooking raw beef.

title: Mattis Grahm
summary: Mattis 'BomuBoi' Grahm is the second artist hired by Mojang Studios to work on Caller's Bane.

title: Glass Pane
summary: A glass pane is a transparent block that can be used as a more efficient alternative to glass blocks.

title: Tick
summary: Nearly all video games (including Minecraft) are driven by one big program loop. Just as every gear in a clock is synchronized with the pendulum, every task involved in advancing a game simulation is synchronized with the game loop. Appropriately, one cycle of the game loop is called a tick.

title: Raw Chicken
summary: Raw chicken is a food item that can be eaten by the player. It can be cooked in a furnace, smoker, or a campfire to make cooked chicken.

title: Cooked Chicken
summary: Cooked chicken is a food item that can be eaten by the player.

title: Adventure Update
summary:
The Adventure Update was a major update to Java Edition focused on fighting, exploration, and adventuring, as well as other aspects. Its content was implemented in Beta 1.8 and 1.0.0. 
It was announced on June 10, 2011 by Notch and  was initially planned to be implemented in Java Edition Beta 1.7. An early version of the Adventure Update was playable by fans at Mojang's booth at PAX Prime 2011, which was held between August 26 and 28. Because of the size of the content, the first part of the update was pushed back to Beta 1.8, which became available on September 14, 2011 and the rest of the update being part of Minecraft 1.0, which was released on November 18, 2011. The pre-releases of Minecraft Beta 1.8 and Beta 1.9 were leaked before their official releases, and Notch approved these leaks on his Twitter.

title: Melon
summary: A melon is a fruit block that grows from a fully-grown melon stem, which in turn is grown from melon seeds.

title: Taiga
summary: The taiga is a cold biome which comprises a grassland forested with ferns and spruce trees.

title: Stronghold
summary: A stronghold is a structure that occurs naturally underground in the Overworld, and is the only place where a player can find an end portal. Strongholds can be located by using an eye of ender.

title: Options
summary: Minecraft's user environment can be configured through the Options setting. A few additional options can be changed only by editing the options.txt file manually.

title: Fog
summary: Fog is a rendering feature intended for obscuring the player's view distance, usually for atmospheric effect or for seamlessly occluding sharp boundaries such as unloaded chunks. While traditionally referring to render distance, there are many other types of fog that can be encountered in-game under specific circumstances.

title: Giant
summary: Giants are unused, over-sized mobs that look like zombies.

title: Herobrine
summary: Herobrine is the subject of a community-made creepypasta.

title: PC Gamer Demo
summary: The PC Gamer Demo is a demo version of Java Edition Beta 1.3, that was bundled with the June 2011 issue of PC Gamer magazine (American edition, issue 214). It provides 100 minutes (equal to five days in-game) of gameplay, after which it tells the player to buy the game in order to continue playing on the current map. But only one splash is on the title screen. It says "PC Gamer Demo!"

title: Ocean Ruins
summary: Ocean ruins or underwater ruins are oceanic structures primarily composed of stone bricks or sandstone. They come in many different sizes varying from large villages to single ruined huts. They are rare, and have cold and warm variants.

title: Stone Bricks
summary:
Stone bricks and the variants  cracked stone bricks,  mossy stone bricks, and  chiseled stone bricks are materials found in structures such as strongholds, igloo basements, jungle temples, ocean ruins and ruined portals.
 Smooth stone bricks are a fifth variant exclusive to Bedrock Edition, visually identical to regular stone bricks, which cannot be found naturally and are only accessible via commands.

title: Village
summary: A village is a group or complex of buildings and other structures that generate naturally in the Overworld. A village is inhabited by villagers, as people, cats, as pets, iron golems, for defense, passive livestock mobs, for farms, occasional zombie villagers, and wandering traders with their trader llamas. A village is a source of resources to the player, obtained from trading, loot chests, and other materials found in the village. Villages are also a target of raid attacks by illagers when a player walks into a village with the Bad Omen effect.

title: Coordinates
summary: Coordinates numerically represent a location in a dimension.

title: Silverfish
summary: Silverfish are small hostile mobs found hiding in stone-like blocks in mountains, strongholds, igloo basements and woodland mansions. They crawl at their targets to bite them, and attacking them will incite other nearby silverfish to emerge from their blocks and attack the aggressor.

title: Minecraft 4k
summary: Minecraft 4k was an edition of Minecraft developed for the 2010 Java 4K contest, where the entry games were required to be within four kibibytes (4096 bytes) in size.

title: Canyon
summary: A canyon (commonly referred to as ravine) is a deep, long crack generating in the Overworld that can connect with caves. They often appear deep underground but can breach the surface.

title: Huge mushroom
summary: Huge mushrooms are tree-like features that consist of mushroom blocks. They can be found naturally in swamp‌, Flower Forest‌, dark forest, and mushroom fields biomes, or grown from a small mushroom by applying bone meal on it - small mushrooms do not turn into huge mushrooms naturally.

title: Farm
summary: A farm is a generated structure in a village used for growing various crops.

title: Classic server protocol
